## docker-compose.yml
================================================================================

----- FILE: docker-compose.yml -----
     1	services:
     2	  postgres:
     3	    image: postgres:15
     4	    environment:
     5	      POSTGRES_DB: ecommerce
     6	      POSTGRES_USER: postgres
     7	      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: postgres
     8	    ports:
     9	      - "5432:5432"
    10	    volumes:
    11	      - postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
    12	    networks:
    13	      - ecommerce-net
    14	
    15	  rabbitmq:
    16	    image: rabbitmq:3-management
    17	    ports:
    18	      - "5672:5672"
    19	      - "15672:15672"
    20	    volumes:
    21	      - rabbitmq_data:/var/lib/rabbitmq
    22	    networks:
    23	      - ecommerce-net
    24	
    25	  config-server:
    26	    build:
    27	      context: ./config-server/config-server
    28	    ports:
    29	      - "8888:8888"
    30	    restart: on-failure
    31	    networks:
    32	      - ecommerce-net
    33	
    34	  eureka-server:
    35	    build:
    36	      context: ./eureka-server/eureka-server
    37	    ports:
    38	      - "8761:8761"
    39	    restart: on-failure
    40	    networks:
    41	      - ecommerce-net
    42	
    43	  api-gateway:
    44	    build:
    45	      context: ./api-gateway/api-gateway
    46	    ports:
    47	      - "8085:8080"
    48	    depends_on:
    49	      - eureka-server
    50	      - config-server
    51	    restart: on-failure
    52	    networks:
    53	      - ecommerce-net
    54	
    55	  product-service:
    56	    build:
    57	      context: ./product-service/product-service
    58	    ports:
    59	      - "8081:8081"
    60	    depends_on:
    61	      - postgres
    62	      - eureka-server
    63	      - config-server
    64	    restart: on-failure
    65	    networks:
    66	      - ecommerce-net
    67	
    68	  order-service:
    69	    build:
    70	      context: ./order-service/order-service
    71	    ports:
    72	      - "8082:8082"
    73	    depends_on:
    74	      - postgres
    75	      - rabbitmq
    76	      - eureka-server
    77	      - config-server
    78	    restart: on-failure
    79	    networks:
    80	      - ecommerce-net
    81	
    82	  client-service:
    83	    build:
    84	      context: ./client-service/client-service
    85	    ports:
    86	      - "8084:8084"
    87	    depends_on:
    88	      - postgres
    89	      - eureka-server
    90	      - config-server
    91	    restart: on-failure
    92	    networks:
    93	      - ecommerce-net
    94	
    95	  payment-service:
    96	    build:
    97	      context: ./payment-service/payment-service
    98	    ports:
    99	      - "8086:8086"
   100	    depends_on:
   101	      - postgres
   102	      - eureka-server
   103	      - config-server
   104	    restart: on-failure
   105	    networks:
   106	      - ecommerce-net
   107	
   108	  batch-service:
   109	    build:
   110	      context: ./batch-service/batch-service
   111	    ports:
   112	      - "8087:8087"
   113	    depends_on:
   114	      - postgres
   115	      - eureka-server
   116	      - config-server
   117	    restart: on-failure
   118	    networks:
   119	      - ecommerce-net
   120

   122	    build:
   123	      context: ./notification-service/notification-service
   124	    ports:
   125	      - "8083:8083"
   126	    depends_on:
   127	      - rabbitmq
   128	      - eureka-server
   129	      - config-server
   130	    restart: on-failure
   131	    networks:
   132	      - ecommerce-net

   139	  rabbitmq_data:
   140	  postgres_data:

## Key configs (application.yml / properties)

----- FILE: ./api-gateway/api-gateway/src/main/resources/application.yml -----
     1	server:
     2	  port: 8080
     3	
     4	spring:
     5	  application:
     6	    name: api-gateway
     7	
     8	  cloud:
     9	    compatibility-verifier:
    10	      enabled: false
    11	
    12	    gateway:
    13	      discovery:
    14	        locator:
    15	          enabled: true
    16	          lower-case-service-id: true
    17	
    18	      routes:
    19	        - id: product-service
    20	          uri: lb://product-service
    21	          predicates:
    22	            - Path=/api/products/**
    23	          filters:
    24	            - PreserveHostHeader=true
    25	
    26	        - id: order-service
    27	          uri: lb://order-service
    28	          predicates:
    29	            - Path=/api/orders/**
    30	          filters:
    31	            - PreserveHostHeader=true
    32	
    33	        - id: client-service
    34	          uri: lb://client-service
    35	          predicates:
    36	            - Path=/api/clients/**
    37	          filters:
    38	            - PreserveHostHeader=true
    39	
    40	        - id: payment-service
    41	          uri: lb://payment-service
    42	          predicates:
    43	            - Path=/api/payments/**
    44	          filters:
    45	            - PreserveHostHeader=true
    46	
    47	        - id: batch-service
    48	          uri: lb://batch-service
    49	          predicates:
    50	            - Path=/api/batch/**
    51	          filters:
    52	            - PreserveHostHeader=true
    53	
    54	        - id: notification-service
    55	          uri: lb://notification-service
    56	          predicates:
    57	            - Path=/api/notifications/**
    58	          filters:
    59	            - PreserveHostHeader=true
    60	
    61	      globalcors:
    62	        corsConfigurations:
    63	          '[/**]':
    64	            allowedOriginPatterns: "*"
    65	            allowedMethods: "*"
    66	            allowedHeaders: "*"
    67	            allowCredentials: true
    68	
    69	  config:
    70	    import: optional:configserver:http://config-server:8888
    71	
    72	eureka:
    73	  client:
    74	    register-with-eureka: true
    75	    fetch-registry: true
    76	    service-url:
    77	      defaultZone: http://eureka-server:8761/eureka/
    78	  instance:
    79	    prefer-ip-address: true
    80	
    81	management:
    82	  endpoints:
    83	    web:
    84	      exposure:
    85	        include: "*"

----- FILE: ./api-gateway/api-gateway/pom.xml -----
     1	<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
     2	         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
     3	         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0
     4	         http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
     5	
     6	    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
     7	
     8	    <groupId>com.ecommerce.gateway</groupId>
     9	    <artifactId>api-gateway</artifactId>
    10	    <version>1.0.0</version>
    11	    <packaging>jar</packaging>
    12	
    13	    <name>api-gateway</name>
    14	
    15	    <!-- âœ… Spring Boot 3.3.x compatible -->
    16	    <parent>
    17	        <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
    18	        <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
    19	        <version>3.4.0</version>
    20	        <relativePath/>
    21	    </parent>
    22	
    23	    <properties>
    24	        <java.version>17</java.version>
    25	        <spring-cloud.version>2024.0.1</spring-cloud.version>
    26	    </properties>
    27	
    28	    <dependencies>
    29	
    30	        <!-- ðŸŒ Spring Cloud Gateway -->
    31	        <dependency>
    32	            <groupId>org.springframework.cloud</groupId>
    33	            <artifactId>spring-cloud-starter-gateway</artifactId>
    34	        </dependency>
    35	
    36	        <!-- â˜ï¸ Config Client (for Spring Cloud Config Server) -->
    37	        <dependency>
    38	            <groupId>org.springframework.cloud</groupId>
    39	            <artifactId>spring-cloud-starter-config</artifactId>
    40	        </dependency>
    41	
    42	        <!-- ðŸ”Ž Eureka Client (for Service Discovery) -->
    43	        <dependency>
    44	            <groupId>org.springframework.cloud</groupId>
    45	            <artifactId>spring-cloud-starter-netflix-eureka-client</artifactId>
    46	        </dependency>
    47	
    48	        <!-- ðŸ“Š Actuator (to expose /actuator/gateway/routes and health endpoints) -->
    49	        <dependency>
    50	            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
    51	            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-actuator</artifactId>
    52	        </dependency>
    53	
    54	        <!-- ðŸ§© Optional: Feign client support if gateway calls other services -->
    55	        <dependency>
    56	            <groupId>org.springframework.cloud</groupId>
    57	            <artifactId>spring-cloud-starter-openfeign</artifactId>
    58	        </dependency>
    59	
    60	        <!-- ðŸ§° Lombok (optional, only for internal POJOs) -->
    61	        <dependency>
    62	            <groupId>org.projectlombok</groupId>
    63	            <artifactId>lombok</artifactId>
    64	            <optional>true</optional>
    65	        </dependency>
    66	
    67	        <!-- ðŸ§ª Test support -->
    68	        <dependency>
    69	            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
    70	            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-test</artifactId>
    71	            <scope>test</scope>
    72	        </dependency>
    73	
    74	    </dependencies>
    75	
    76	    <dependencyManagement>
    77	        <dependencies>
    78	            <dependency>
    79	                <groupId>org.springframework.cloud</groupId>
    80	                <artifactId>spring-cloud-dependencies</artifactId>
    81	                <version>${spring-cloud.version}</version>
    82	                <type>pom</type>
    83	                <scope>import</scope>
    84	            </dependency>
    85	        </dependencies>
    86	    </dependencyManagement>
    87	
    88	    <build>
    89	        <plugins>
    90	            <plugin>
    91	                <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
    92	                <artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId>
    93	            </plugin>
    94	        </plugins>
    95	    </build>
    96	
    97	</project>

----- FILE: ./notification-service/notification-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/notification/service/config/RabbitMQConfig.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.notification.service.config;
     2	
     3	import org.springframework.amqp.core.*;
     4	import org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.connection.ConnectionFactory;
     5	import org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.core.RabbitAdmin;
     6	import org.springframework.amqp.support.converter.Jackson2JsonMessageConverter;
     7	import org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.config.SimpleRabbitListenerContainerFactory;
     8	import org.springframework.context.annotation.Bean;
     9	import org.springframework.context.annotation.Configuration;
    10	import org.springframework.boot.context.event.ApplicationReadyEvent;
    11	import org.springframework.context.event.EventListener;
    12	
    13	@Configuration
    14	public class RabbitMQConfig {
    15	
    16	    public static final String EXCHANGE_NAME = "notificationExchange";
    17	    public static final String QUEUE_NAME = "notificationQueue";
    18	
    19	    @Bean
    20	    public Queue notificationQueue() {
    21	        return new Queue(QUEUE_NAME, true);
    22	    }
    23	
    24	    @Bean
    25	    public DirectExchange notificationExchange() {
    26	        return new DirectExchange(EXCHANGE_NAME);
    27	    }
    28	
    29	    @Bean
    30	    public Binding binding(Queue notificationQueue, DirectExchange notificationExchange) {
    31	        return BindingBuilder.bind(notificationQueue).to(notificationExchange).with(QUEUE_NAME);
    32	    }
    33	
    34	    @Bean
    35	    public RabbitAdmin rabbitAdmin(ConnectionFactory connectionFactory) {
    36	        RabbitAdmin admin = new RabbitAdmin(connectionFactory);
    37	        admin.setAutoStartup(true);
    38	        return admin;
    39	    }
    40	
    41	    @Bean
    42	    public Jackson2JsonMessageConverter jackson2JsonMessageConverter() {
    43	        return new Jackson2JsonMessageConverter();
    44	    }
    45	
    46	    @Bean
    47	    public SimpleRabbitListenerContainerFactory rabbitListenerContainerFactory(
    48	            ConnectionFactory connectionFactory,
    49	            Jackson2JsonMessageConverter converter) {
    50	        SimpleRabbitListenerContainerFactory factory = new SimpleRabbitListenerContainerFactory();
    51	        factory.setConnectionFactory(connectionFactory);
    52	        factory.setMessageConverter(converter);
    53	        return factory;
    54	    }
    55	
    56	    @EventListener(ApplicationReadyEvent.class)
    57	    public void declareQueueWhenReady(ApplicationReadyEvent event) {
    58	        RabbitAdmin admin = event.getApplicationContext().getBean(RabbitAdmin.class);
    59	        admin.declareExchange(notificationExchange());
    60	        admin.declareQueue(notificationQueue());
    61	        admin.declareBinding(binding(notificationQueue(), notificationExchange()));
    62	        System.out.println("âœ… Declared queue, exchange, and binding after app ready.");
    63	    }
    64	}

----- FILE: ./notification-service/notification-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/notification/service/controller/NotificationController.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.notification.service.controller;
     2	
     3	import org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.core.RabbitTemplate;
     4	import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.*;
     5	
     6	@RestController
     7	@RequestMapping("/api/notifications")
     8	public class NotificationController {
     9	
    10	    private final RabbitTemplate rabbitTemplate;
    11	
    12	    public NotificationController(RabbitTemplate rabbitTemplate) {
    13	        this.rabbitTemplate = rabbitTemplate;
    14	    }
    15	
    16	    @PostMapping("/send")
    17	    public String send(@RequestBody String message) {
    18	        rabbitTemplate.convertAndSend("notification.queue", message);
    19	        return "Notification sent âœ…";
    20	    }
    21	}

----- FILE: ./notification-service/notification-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/notification/service/listener/NotificationListener.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.notification.service.listener;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.notification.service.config.RabbitMQConfig;
     4	import com.ecommerce.notification.service.model.NotificationMessage;
     5	import com.ecommerce.notification.service.store.NotificationStore;
     6	import org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.annotation.RabbitListener;
     7	import org.springframework.stereotype.Component;
     8	
     9	@Component
    10	public class NotificationListener {
    11	
    12	  private final NotificationStore store;
    13	
    14	  public NotificationListener(NotificationStore store) {
    15	    this.store = store;
    16	  }
    17	
    18	  @RabbitListener(queues = RabbitMQConfig.QUEUE_NAME, containerFactory = "rabbitListenerContainerFactory")
    19	  public void onMessage(NotificationMessage msg) {
    20	    String subject = "Notification";
    21	    String text = msg != null ? msg.getMessage() : "(empty)";
    22	    System.out.println("ðŸ“¥ Notification received: " + text);
    23	
    24	    store.add(new NotificationStore.Item(subject, text,
    25	      msg != null ? msg.getTo() : null,
    26	      msg != null ? msg.getPhone() : null
    27	    ));
    28	  }
    29	}

----- FILE: ./notification-service/notification-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/notification/service/model/NotificationMessage.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.notification.service.model;
     2	
     3	import java.util.List;
     4	
     5	public class NotificationMessage {
     6	  private List<String> to;
     7	  private String phone;
     8	  private String message;
     9	
    10	  public NotificationMessage() {}
    11	
    12	  public NotificationMessage(List<String> to, String phone, String message) {
    13	    this.to = to;
    14	    this.phone = phone;
    15	    this.message = message;
    16	  }
    17	
    18	  public List<String> getTo() { return to; }
    19	  public void setTo(List<String> to) { this.to = to; }
    20	
    21	  public String getPhone() { return phone; }
    22	  public void setPhone(String phone) { this.phone = phone; }
    23	
    24	  public String getMessage() { return message; }
    25	  public void setMessage(String message) { this.message = message; }
    26	}

----- FILE: ./notification-service/notification-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/notification/service/service/EmailService.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.notification.service.service;
     2	
     3	import lombok.RequiredArgsConstructor;
     4	import org.springframework.mail.SimpleMailMessage;
     5	import org.springframework.mail.javamail.JavaMailSender;
     6	import org.springframework.stereotype.Service;
     7	import java.util.List;
     8	
     9	@Service
    10	@RequiredArgsConstructor
    11	public class EmailService {
    12	
    13	    private final JavaMailSender mailSender;
    14	
    15	    public void sendNotificationEmail(List<String> toList, String subject, String text) {
    16	        SimpleMailMessage message = new SimpleMailMessage();
    17	        message.setTo(toList.toArray(new String[0]));
    18	        message.setSubject(subject);
    19	        message.setText(text);
    20	        mailSender.send(message);
    21	        System.out.println("ðŸ“§ Email sent to " + toList);
    22	    }
    23	}

----- FILE: ./notification-service/notification-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/notification/service/store/NotificationStore.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.notification.service.store;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.notification.service.model.NotificationMessage;
     4	import org.springframework.stereotype.Component;
     5	
     6	import java.time.Instant;
     7	import java.util.ArrayList;
     8	import java.util.Collections;
     9	import java.util.List;
    10	
    11	@Component
    12	public class NotificationStore {
    13	
    14	  public static class Item {
    15	    public String subject;
    16	    public String message;
    17	    public List<String> to;
    18	    public String phone;
    19	    public String createdAt;
    20	
    21	    public Item() {}
    22	
    23	    public Item(String subject, String message, List<String> to, String phone) {
    24	      this.subject = subject;
    25	      this.message = message;
    26	      this.to = to;
    27	      this.phone = phone;
    28	      this.createdAt = Instant.now().toString();
    29	    }
    30	  }
    31	
    32	  private final List<Item> items = Collections.synchronizedList(new ArrayList<>());
    33	
    34	  public void add(Item i) {
    35	    items.add(0, i); // newest first
    36	    if (items.size() > 200) items.remove(items.size() - 1);
    37	  }
    38	
    39	  public List<Item> all() {
    40	    return new ArrayList<>(items);
    41	  }
    42	}

----- FILE: ./order-service/order-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/order/service/client/ProductClient.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.order.service.client;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.order.service.model.Product;
     4	import org.springframework.cloud.openfeign.FeignClient;
     5	import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.GetMapping;
     6	import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.PathVariable;
     7	
     8	@FeignClient(
     9	        name = "PRODUCT-SERVICE",
    10	        path = "/api/products",
    11	        fallback = ProductClientFallback.class
    12	)
    13	public interface ProductClient {
    14	
    15	    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    16	    Product getProductById(@PathVariable("id") Long id);
    17	}

----- FILE: ./order-service/order-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/order/service/client/ProductClientFallback.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.order.service.client;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.order.service.model.Product;
     4	import org.springframework.stereotype.Component;
     5	
     6	@Component
     7	public class ProductClientFallback implements ProductClient {
     8	
     9	    @Override
    10	    public Product getProductById(Long id) {
    11	        System.err.println("âš ï¸ Fallback triggered for product ID " + id);
    12	        return new Product(
    13	                id,
    14	                "Unknown Product",
    15	                "Fallback - product service unavailable",
    16	                0.0,
    17	                0
    18	        );
    19	    }
    20	}

----- FILE: ./order-service/order-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/order/service/config/RabbitMQConfig.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.order.service.config;
     2	
     3	import org.springframework.amqp.core.Binding;
     4	import org.springframework.amqp.core.BindingBuilder;
     5	import org.springframework.amqp.core.DirectExchange;
     6	import org.springframework.amqp.core.Queue;
     7	import org.springframework.context.annotation.Bean;
     8	import org.springframework.context.annotation.Configuration;
     9	
    10	@Configuration
    11	public class RabbitMQConfig {
    12	
    13	    public static final String EXCHANGE_NAME = "notificationExchange";
    14	    public static final String QUEUE_NAME = "notificationQueue";
    15	
    16	    @Bean
    17	    public Queue notificationQueue() {
    18	        return new Queue(QUEUE_NAME, true);
    19	    }
    20	
    21	    @Bean
    22	    public DirectExchange notificationExchange() {
    23	        return new DirectExchange(EXCHANGE_NAME);
    24	    }
    25	
    26	    @Bean
    27	    public Binding binding(Queue notificationQueue, DirectExchange notificationExchange) {
    28	        return BindingBuilder.bind(notificationQueue).to(notificationExchange).with(QUEUE_NAME);
    29	    }
    30	}

----- FILE: ./order-service/order-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/order/service/controller/OrderController.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.order.service.controller;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.order.service.model.Order;
     4	import com.ecommerce.order.service.service.OrderService;
     5	import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.*;
     6	import lombok.RequiredArgsConstructor;
     7	import java.util.List;
     8	
     9	@RestController
    10	@RequestMapping("/api/orders")
    11	@RequiredArgsConstructor
    12	public class OrderController {
    13	    private final OrderService orderService;
    14	
    15	    @GetMapping
    16	    public List<Order> getAllOrders() {
    17	        return orderService.getAllOrders();
    18	    }
    19	
    20	    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    21	    public Order getOrderById(@PathVariable Long id) {
    22	        return orderService.getOrderById(id);
    23	    }
    24	
    25	    @PostMapping
    26	    public Order createOrder(@RequestParam Long productId, @RequestParam Integer quantity) {
    27	        return orderService.createOrder(productId, quantity);
    28	    }
    29	
    30	    @DeleteMapping("/{id}")
    31	    public void deleteOrder(@PathVariable Long id) {
    32	        orderService.deleteOrder(id);
    33	    }
    34	}

----- FILE: ./order-service/order-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/order/service/model/Order.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.order.service.model;
     2	
     3	import jakarta.persistence.*;
     4	import lombok.*;
     5	
     6	@Entity
     7	@Data
     8	@AllArgsConstructor
     9	@NoArgsConstructor
    10	@Builder
    11	@Table(name = "orders")
    12	public class Order {
    13	    @Id
    14	    @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)
    15	    private Long id;
    16	
    17	    private Long productId;
    18	    private Integer quantity;
    19	    private Double totalPrice;
    20	    private String status;
    21	}

----- FILE: ./order-service/order-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/order/service/service/NotificationProducer.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.order.service.service;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.order.service.model.NotificationMessage;
     4	import org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.core.RabbitTemplate;
     5	import org.springframework.stereotype.Service;
     6	
     7	@Service
     8	public class NotificationProducer {
     9	
    10	    private final RabbitTemplate rabbitTemplate;
    11	
    12	    public NotificationProducer(RabbitTemplate rabbitTemplate) {
    13	        this.rabbitTemplate = rabbitTemplate;
    14	    }
    15	
    16	    public void sendNotification(NotificationMessage message) {
    17	        // The queue name must match NotificationService
    18	        rabbitTemplate.convertAndSend("notificationQueue", message);
    19	        System.out.println("ðŸ“¤ Notification message sent to RabbitMQ!");
    20	    }
    21	}

----- FILE: ./order-service/order-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/order/service/service/OrderService.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.order.service.service;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.order.service.client.ProductClient;
     4	import com.ecommerce.order.service.model.NotificationMessage;
     5	import com.ecommerce.order.service.model.Order;
     6	import com.ecommerce.order.service.model.Product;
     7	import com.ecommerce.order.service.repository.OrderRepository;
     8	import io.github.resilience4j.circuitbreaker.annotation.CircuitBreaker;
     9	import lombok.RequiredArgsConstructor;
    10	import org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.core.RabbitTemplate;
    11	import org.springframework.stereotype.Service;
    12	
    13	import java.util.List;
    14	
    15	@Service
    16	@RequiredArgsConstructor
    17	public class OrderService {
    18	
    19	    private final OrderRepository orderRepository;
    20	    private final ProductClient productClient;
    21	    private final RabbitTemplate rabbitTemplate;
    22	
    23	    public List<Order> getAllOrders() {
    24	        return orderRepository.findAll();
    25	    }
    26	
    27	    public Order getOrderById(Long id) {
    28	        return orderRepository.findById(id).orElse(null);
    29	    }
    30	
    31	    @CircuitBreaker(name = "productService", fallbackMethod = "fallbackCreateOrder")
    32	    public Order createOrder(Long productId, Integer quantity) {
    33	        Product product = productClient.getProductById(productId);
    34	
    35	        if (product == null || product.getQuantity() < quantity) {
    36	            throw new RuntimeException("Product not available");
    37	        }
    38	
    39	        double totalPrice = product.getPrice() * quantity;
    40	
    41	        Order order = Order.builder()
    42	                .productId(productId)
    43	                .quantity(quantity)
    44	                .totalPrice(totalPrice)
    45	                .status("CREATED")
    46	                .build();
    47	
    48	        Order savedOrder = orderRepository.save(order);
    49	
    50	        // âœ… Send notification message
    51	        try {
    52	            NotificationMessage notification = new NotificationMessage(
    53	                    List.of("ajanamehdi751@gmail.com"),
    54	                    "+212660553886",
    55	                    "ðŸ“¦ Your order #" + savedOrder.getId() + " has been created successfully!"
    56	            );
    57	
    58	            rabbitTemplate.convertAndSend(
    59	                    "notificationExchange",  // Exchange
    60	                    "notificationQueue",     // Routing key
    61	                    notification
    62	            );
    63	
    64	            System.out.println("ðŸ“¤ Sent notification message for order #" + savedOrder.getId());
    65	        } catch (Exception e) {
    66	            System.err.println("âš ï¸ Failed to send notification for order #" + savedOrder.getId() + ": " + e.getMessage());
    67	        }
    68	
    69	        return savedOrder;
    70	    }
    71	
    72	    // âœ… Fallback when product-service fails
    73	    public Order fallbackCreateOrder(Long productId, Integer quantity, Throwable t) {
    74	        System.err.println("âš ï¸ Fallback triggered for product ID " + productId + ": " + t.getMessage());
    75	
    76	        Order failedOrder = Order.builder()
    77	                .productId(productId)
    78	                .quantity(quantity)
    79	                .totalPrice(0.0)
    80	                .status("FAILED (Fallback triggered)")
    81	                .build();
    82	
    83	        Order savedOrder = orderRepository.save(failedOrder);
    84	
    85	        try {
    86	            NotificationMessage notification = new NotificationMessage(
    87	                    List.of("ajanamehdi751@gmail.com"),
    88	                    "+212660553886",
    89	                    "âš ï¸ Order #" + savedOrder.getId() + " failed to process (Fallback triggered)."
    90	            );
    91	
    92	            rabbitTemplate.convertAndSend(
    93	                    "notificationExchange",
    94	                    "notificationQueue",
    95	                    notification
    96	            );
    97	
    98	            System.out.println("ðŸ“¤ Sent fallback notification for order #" + savedOrder.getId());
    99	        } catch (Exception e) {
   100	            System.err.println("âš ï¸ Failed to send fallback notification: " + e.getMessage());
   101	        }
   102	
   103	        return savedOrder;
   104	    }
   105	
   106	    public void deleteOrder(Long id) {
   107	        orderRepository.deleteById(id);
   108	    }
   109	}

----- FILE: ./payment-service/payment-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/payment/service/client/OrderClient.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.payment.service.client;
     2	
     3	import org.springframework.cloud.openfeign.FeignClient;
     4	import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.*;
     5	
     6	@FeignClient(name = "order-service")
     7	public interface OrderClient {
     8	  @PutMapping("/api/orders/{id}/status")
     9	  Object updateStatus(@PathVariable("id") Long id, @RequestBody StatusReq req);
    10	
    11	  record StatusReq(String status) {}
    12	}
    13	

----- FILE: ./payment-service/payment-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/payment/service/config/RabbitMQConfig.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.payment.service.config;
     2	
     3	import org.springframework.amqp.core.*;
     4	import org.springframework.context.annotation.Bean;
     5	import org.springframework.context.annotation.Configuration;
     6	
     7	@Configuration
     8	public class RabbitMQConfig {
     9	
    10	  @Bean
    11	  public DirectExchange notificationExchange() {
    12	    return new DirectExchange("notificationExchange");
    13	  }
    14	
    15	  @Bean
    16	  public Queue notificationQueue() {
    17	    return new Queue("notificationQueue", true);
    18	  }
    19	
    20	  @Bean
    21	  public Binding binding(Queue notificationQueue, DirectExchange notificationExchange) {
    22	    return BindingBuilder.bind(notificationQueue).to(notificationExchange).with("notificationQueue");
    23	  }
    24	}
    25	

================================================================================
## All remaining backend source files (java/yml/xml)

     7	
     8	    <groupId>com.ecommerce.gateway</groupId>
     9	    <artifactId>api-gateway</artifactId>
    10	    <version>1.0.0</version>
    11	    <packaging>jar</packaging>
    12	
    13	    <name>api-gateway</name>
    14	
    15	    <!-- âœ… Spring Boot 3.3.x compatible -->
    16	    <parent>
    17	        <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
    18	        <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
    19	        <version>3.4.0</version>
    20	        <relativePath/>
    21	    </parent>
    22

    24	        <java.version>17</java.version>
    25	        <spring-cloud.version>2024.0.1</spring-cloud.version>
    26	    </properties>
    27	
    28	    <dependencies>
    29

    31	        <dependency>
    32	            <groupId>org.springframework.cloud</groupId>
    33	            <artifactId>spring-cloud-starter-gateway</artifactId>
    34	        </dependency>
    35	
    36	        <!-- â˜ï¸ Config Client (for Spring Cloud Config Server) -->

    38	            <groupId>org.springframework.cloud</groupId>
    39	            <artifactId>spring-cloud-starter-config</artifactId>
    40	        </dependency>

    50	            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
    51	            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-actuator</artifactId>
    52	        </dependency>
    53	
    54	        <!-- ðŸ§© Optional: Feign client support if gateway calls other services -->
    55	        <dependency>
    56	            <groupId>org.springframework.cloud</groupId>
    57	            <artifactId>spring-cloud-starter-openfeign</artifactId>
    58	        </dependency>
    59	
    60	        <!-- ðŸ§° Lombok (optional, only for internal POJOs) -->
    61	        <dependency>
    62	            <groupId>org.projectlombok</groupId>
    63	            <artifactId>lombok</artifactId>
    64	            <optional>true</optional>
    65	        </dependency>
    66

    69	            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
    70	            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-test</artifactId>
    71	            <scope>test</scope>
    72	        </dependency>
    73

    77	        <dependencies>

    80	                <artifactId>spring-cloud-dependencies</artifactId>
    81	                <version>${spring-cloud.version}</version>
    82	                <type>pom</type>
    83	                <scope>import</scope>
    84	            </dependency>
    85	        </dependencies>
    86	    </dependencyManagement>

    91	                <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>

    93	            </plugin>
    94	        </plugins>
    95	    </build>
    96

     1	package com.ecommerce.api.gateway;
     2	
     3	import org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication;
     4	import org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.SpringBootApplication;
     5	import org.springframework.cloud.client.discovery.EnableDiscoveryClient;
     6	
     7	@SpringBootApplication
     8	@EnableDiscoveryClient
     9	public class MainApplication {
    10	    public static void main(String[] args) {
    11	        SpringApplication.run(MainApplication.class, args);
    12	    }
    13	}

----- FILE: ./api-gateway/api-gateway/src/main/resources/application.yml -----
     1	server:
     2	  port: 8080
     3	
     4	spring:
     5	  application:
     6	    name: api-gateway
     7	
     8	  cloud:
     9	    compatibility-verifier:
    10	      enabled: false
    11	
    12	    gateway:
    13	      discovery:
    14	        locator:
    15	          enabled: true
    16	          lower-case-service-id: true
    17	
    18	      routes:
    19	        - id: product-service
    20	          uri: lb://product-service
    21	          predicates:
    22	            - Path=/api/products/**
    23	          filters:
    24	            - PreserveHostHeader=true
    25	
    26	        - id: order-service
    27	          uri: lb://order-service
    28	          predicates:
    29	            - Path=/api/orders/**
    30	          filters:
    31	            - PreserveHostHeader=true
    32	
    33	        - id: client-service
    34	          uri: lb://client-service
    35	          predicates:
    36	            - Path=/api/clients/**
    37	          filters:
    38	            - PreserveHostHeader=true
    39	
    40	        - id: payment-service
    41	          uri: lb://payment-service
    42	          predicates:
    43	            - Path=/api/payments/**
    44	          filters:
    45	            - PreserveHostHeader=true
    46	
    47	        - id: batch-service
    48	          uri: lb://batch-service
    49	          predicates:
    50	            - Path=/api/batch/**
    51	          filters:
    52	            - PreserveHostHeader=true
    53	
    54	        - id: notification-service
    55	          uri: lb://notification-service
    56	          predicates:
    57	            - Path=/api/notifications/**
    58	          filters:
    59	            - PreserveHostHeader=true
    60	
    61	      globalcors:
    62	        corsConfigurations:
    63	          '[/**]':
    64	            allowedOriginPatterns: "*"
    65	            allowedMethods: "*"
    66	            allowedHeaders: "*"
    67	            allowCredentials: true
    68	
    69	  config:
    70	    import: optional:configserver:http://config-server:8888
    71	
    72	eureka:
    73	  client:
    74	    register-with-eureka: true
    75	    fetch-registry: true
    76	    service-url:
    77	      defaultZone: http://eureka-server:8761/eureka/
    78	  instance:
    79	    prefer-ip-address: true
    80	
    81	management:
    82	  endpoints:
    83	    web:
    84	      exposure:
    85	        include: "*"

----- FILE: ./batch-service/batch-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/batch/service/config/BatchConfig.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.batch.service.config;
     2	
     3	import org.springframework.batch.core.Job;
     4	import org.springframework.batch.core.Step;
     5	import org.springframework.batch.core.job.builder.JobBuilder;
     6	import org.springframework.batch.core.repository.JobRepository;
     7	import org.springframework.batch.core.step.builder.StepBuilder;
     8	import org.springframework.batch.repeat.RepeatStatus;
     9	import org.springframework.context.annotation.Bean;
    10	import org.springframework.context.annotation.Configuration;
    11	import org.springframework.transaction.PlatformTransactionManager;
    12	
    13	@Configuration
    14	public class BatchConfig {
    15	
    16	  @Bean
    17	  public Step nightlyStep(JobRepository jobRepository, PlatformTransactionManager txManager) {
    18	    return new StepBuilder("nightlyStep", jobRepository)
    19	      .tasklet((contribution, chunkContext) -> {
    20	        System.out.println("âœ… Nightly batch executed (placeholder for pending orders processing)");
    21	        return RepeatStatus.FINISHED;
    22	      }, txManager)
    23	      .build();
    24	  }
    25	
    26	  @Bean
    27	  public Job nightlyOrdersJob(JobRepository jobRepository, Step nightlyStep) {
    28	    return new JobBuilder("nightlyOrdersJob", jobRepository)
    29	      .start(nightlyStep)
    30	      .build();
    31	  }
    32	}
    33	

----- FILE: ./batch-service/batch-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/batch/service/controller/BatchController.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.batch.service.controller;
     2	
     3	import org.springframework.batch.core.Job;
     4	import org.springframework.batch.core.JobParametersBuilder;
     5	import org.springframework.batch.core.launch.JobLauncher;
     6	import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.*;
     7	
     8	@RestController
     9	@RequestMapping("/api/batch")
    10	public class BatchController {
    11	
    12	  private final JobLauncher launcher;
    13	  private final Job nightlyOrdersJob;
    14	
    15	  public BatchController(JobLauncher launcher, Job nightlyOrdersJob) {
    16	    this.launcher = launcher;
    17	    this.nightlyOrdersJob = nightlyOrdersJob;
    18	  }
    19	
    20	  @PostMapping("/run")
    21	  public String run() throws Exception {
    22	    launcher.run(nightlyOrdersJob,
    23	      new JobParametersBuilder().addLong("time", System.currentTimeMillis()).toJobParameters()
    24	    );
    25	    return "Batch triggered âœ…";
    26	  }
    27	}
    28

    12	    }
    13	}

----- FILE: ./client-service/client-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/client/service/MainApplication.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.client.service;
     2	
     3	import org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication;
     4	import org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.SpringBootApplication;
     5	
     6	@SpringBootApplication
     7	public class MainApplication {
     8	  public static void main(String[] args) {
     9	    SpringApplication.run(MainApplication.class, args);
    10	  }
    11	}
    12	

----- FILE: ./client-service/client-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/client/service/controller/ClientController.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.client.service.controller;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.client.service.dto.ClientRequest;
     4	import com.ecommerce.client.service.model.Client;
     5	import com.ecommerce.client.service.repository.ClientRepository;
     6	import jakarta.validation.Valid;
     7	import org.springframework.http.HttpStatus;
     8	import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.*;
     9	
    10	import java.time.Instant;
    11	import java.util.List;
    12	
    13	@RestController
    14	@RequestMapping("/api/clients")
    15	public class ClientController {
    16	
    17	  private final ClientRepository repo;
    18	
    19	  public ClientController(ClientRepository repo) {
    20	    this.repo = repo;
    21	  }
    22	
    23	  @GetMapping
    24	  public List<Client> all() { return repo.findAll(); }
    25	
    26	  @GetMapping("/{id}")
    27	  public Client one(@PathVariable Long id) {
    28	    return repo.findById(id).orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Client not found"));
    29	  }
    30	
    31	  @PostMapping
    32	  @ResponseStatus(HttpStatus.CREATED)
    33	  public Client create(@Valid @RequestBody ClientRequest req) {
    34	    if (repo.existsByEmail(req.email())) throw new RuntimeException("Email already exists");
    35	    Client c = Client.builder()
    36	      .fullName(req.fullName())
    37	      .email(req.email())
    38	      .phone(req.phone())
    39	      .address(req.address())
    40	      .createdAt(Instant.now())
    41	      .build();
    42	    return repo.save(c);
    43	  }
    44	
    45	  @PutMapping("/{id}")
    46	  public Client update(@PathVariable Long id, @Valid @RequestBody ClientRequest req) {
    47	    Client c = repo.findById(id).orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Client not found"));
    48	    c.setFullName(req.fullName());
    49	    c.setPhone(req.phone());
    50	    c.setAddress(req.address());
    51	    return repo.save(c);
    52	  }
    53	
    54	  @DeleteMapping("/{id}")
    55	  @ResponseStatus(HttpStatus.NO_CONTENT)
    56	  public void delete(@PathVariable Long id) { repo.deleteById(id); }
    57	}
    58	

----- FILE: ./client-service/client-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/client/service/dto/ClientRequest.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.client.service.dto;
     2	
     3	import jakarta.validation.constraints.Email;
     4	import jakarta.validation.constraints.NotBlank;
     5	
     6	public record ClientRequest(
     7	  @NotBlank String fullName,
     8	  @NotBlank @Email String email,
     9	  String phone,
    10	  String address
    11	) {}
    12	

----- FILE: ./client-service/client-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/client/service/model/Client.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.client.service.model;
     2	
     3	import jakarta.persistence.*;
     4	import lombok.*;
     5	
     6	import java.time.Instant;
     7	
     8	@Entity
     9	@Table(name = "clients")
    10	@Getter @Setter @NoArgsConstructor @AllArgsConstructor @Builder
    11	public class Client {
    12	  @Id
    13	  @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)
    14	  private Long id;
    15	
    16	  @Column(nullable = false)
    17	  private String fullName;
    18	
    19	  @Column(nullable = false, unique = true)
    20	  private String email;
    21	
    22	  private String phone;
    23	  private String address;
    24	
    25	  @Column(nullable = false)
    26	  private Instant createdAt;
    27	}
    28	

----- FILE: ./client-service/client-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/client/service/repository/ClientRepository.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.client.service.repository;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.client.service.model.Client;
     4	import org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository;
     5	
     6	public interface ClientRepository extends JpaRepository<Client, Long> {
     7	  boolean existsByEmail(String email);
     8	}
     9

     1	package com.ecommerce.notification.service;
     2	
     3	import org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication;
     4	import org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.SpringBootApplication;
     5	import org.springframework.context.annotation.ComponentScan;
     6

     8	@ComponentScan(basePackages = "com.ecommerce.notification.service")

----- FILE: ./notification-service/notification-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/notification/service/config/RabbitMQConfig.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.notification.service.config;
     2	
     3	import org.springframework.amqp.core.*;
     4	import org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.connection.ConnectionFactory;
     5	import org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.core.RabbitAdmin;
     6	import org.springframework.amqp.support.converter.Jackson2JsonMessageConverter;
     7	import org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.config.SimpleRabbitListenerContainerFactory;
     8	import org.springframework.context.annotation.Bean;
     9	import org.springframework.context.annotation.Configuration;
    10	import org.springframework.boot.context.event.ApplicationReadyEvent;
    11	import org.springframework.context.event.EventListener;
    12	
    13	@Configuration
    14	public class RabbitMQConfig {
    15	
    16	    public static final String EXCHANGE_NAME = "notificationExchange";
    17	    public static final String QUEUE_NAME = "notificationQueue";
    18	
    19	    @Bean
    20	    public Queue notificationQueue() {
    21	        return new Queue(QUEUE_NAME, true);
    22	    }
    23	
    24	    @Bean
    25	    public DirectExchange notificationExchange() {
    26	        return new DirectExchange(EXCHANGE_NAME);
    27	    }
    28	
    29	    @Bean
    30	    public Binding binding(Queue notificationQueue, DirectExchange notificationExchange) {
    31	        return BindingBuilder.bind(notificationQueue).to(notificationExchange).with(QUEUE_NAME);
    32	    }
    33	
    34	    @Bean
    35	    public RabbitAdmin rabbitAdmin(ConnectionFactory connectionFactory) {
    36	        RabbitAdmin admin = new RabbitAdmin(connectionFactory);
    37	        admin.setAutoStartup(true);
    38	        return admin;
    39	    }
    40	
    41	    @Bean
    42	    public Jackson2JsonMessageConverter jackson2JsonMessageConverter() {
    43	        return new Jackson2JsonMessageConverter();
    44	    }
    45	
    46	    @Bean
    47	    public SimpleRabbitListenerContainerFactory rabbitListenerContainerFactory(
    48	            ConnectionFactory connectionFactory,
    49	            Jackson2JsonMessageConverter converter) {
    50	        SimpleRabbitListenerContainerFactory factory = new SimpleRabbitListenerContainerFactory();
    51	        factory.setConnectionFactory(connectionFactory);
    52	        factory.setMessageConverter(converter);
    53	        return factory;
    54	    }
    55	
    56	    @EventListener(ApplicationReadyEvent.class)
    57	    public void declareQueueWhenReady(ApplicationReadyEvent event) {
    58	        RabbitAdmin admin = event.getApplicationContext().getBean(RabbitAdmin.class);
    59	        admin.declareExchange(notificationExchange());
    60	        admin.declareQueue(notificationQueue());
    61	        admin.declareBinding(binding(notificationQueue(), notificationExchange()));
    62	        System.out.println("âœ… Declared queue, exchange, and binding after app ready.");
    63	    }
    64	}

----- FILE: ./notification-service/notification-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/notification/service/controller/NotificationController.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.notification.service.controller;
     2	
     3	import org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.core.RabbitTemplate;
     4	import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.*;
     5	
     6	@RestController
     7	@RequestMapping("/api/notifications")
     8	public class NotificationController {
     9	
    10	    private final RabbitTemplate rabbitTemplate;
    11	
    12	    public NotificationController(RabbitTemplate rabbitTemplate) {
    13	        this.rabbitTemplate = rabbitTemplate;
    14	    }
    15	
    16	    @PostMapping("/send")
    17	    public String send(@RequestBody String message) {
    18	        rabbitTemplate.convertAndSend("notification.queue", message);
    19	        return "Notification sent âœ…";
    20	    }
    21	}

----- FILE: ./notification-service/notification-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/notification/service/listener/NotificationListener.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.notification.service.listener;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.notification.service.config.RabbitMQConfig;
     4	import com.ecommerce.notification.service.model.NotificationMessage;
     5	import com.ecommerce.notification.service.store.NotificationStore;
     6	import org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.annotation.RabbitListener;
     7	import org.springframework.stereotype.Component;
     8	
     9	@Component
    10	public class NotificationListener {
    11	
    12	  private final NotificationStore store;
    13	
    14	  public NotificationListener(NotificationStore store) {
    15	    this.store = store;
    16	  }
    17	
    18	  @RabbitListener(queues = RabbitMQConfig.QUEUE_NAME, containerFactory = "rabbitListenerContainerFactory")
    19	  public void onMessage(NotificationMessage msg) {
    20	    String subject = "Notification";
    21	    String text = msg != null ? msg.getMessage() : "(empty)";
    22	    System.out.println("ðŸ“¥ Notification received: " + text);
    23	
    24	    store.add(new NotificationStore.Item(subject, text,
    25	      msg != null ? msg.getTo() : null,
    26	      msg != null ? msg.getPhone() : null
    27	    ));
    28	  }
    29	}

----- FILE: ./notification-service/notification-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/notification/service/model/NotificationMessage.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.notification.service.model;
     2	
     3	import java.util.List;
     4	
     5	public class NotificationMessage {
     6	  private List<String> to;
     7	  private String phone;
     8	  private String message;
     9	
    10	  public NotificationMessage() {}
    11	
    12	  public NotificationMessage(List<String> to, String phone, String message) {
    13	    this.to = to;
    14	    this.phone = phone;
    15	    this.message = message;
    16	  }
    17	
    18	  public List<String> getTo() { return to; }
    19	  public void setTo(List<String> to) { this.to = to; }
    20	
    21	  public String getPhone() { return phone; }
    22	  public void setPhone(String phone) { this.phone = phone; }
    23	
    24	  public String getMessage() { return message; }
    25	  public void setMessage(String message) { this.message = message; }
    26	}

----- FILE: ./notification-service/notification-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/notification/service/service/EmailService.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.notification.service.service;
     2	
     3	import lombok.RequiredArgsConstructor;
     4	import org.springframework.mail.SimpleMailMessage;
     5	import org.springframework.mail.javamail.JavaMailSender;
     6	import org.springframework.stereotype.Service;
     7	import java.util.List;
     8	
     9	@Service
    10	@RequiredArgsConstructor
    11	public class EmailService {
    12	
    13	    private final JavaMailSender mailSender;
    14	
    15	    public void sendNotificationEmail(List<String> toList, String subject, String text) {
    16	        SimpleMailMessage message = new SimpleMailMessage();
    17	        message.setTo(toList.toArray(new String[0]));
    18	        message.setSubject(subject);
    19	        message.setText(text);
    20	        mailSender.send(message);
    21	        System.out.println("ðŸ“§ Email sent to " + toList);
    22	    }
    23	}

----- FILE: ./notification-service/notification-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/notification/service/store/NotificationStore.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.notification.service.store;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.notification.service.model.NotificationMessage;
     4	import org.springframework.stereotype.Component;
     5	
     6	import java.time.Instant;
     7	import java.util.ArrayList;
     8	import java.util.Collections;
     9	import java.util.List;
    10	
    11	@Component
    12	public class NotificationStore {
    13	
    14	  public static class Item {
    15	    public String subject;
    16	    public String message;
    17	    public List<String> to;
    18	    public String phone;
    19	    public String createdAt;
    20	
    21	    public Item() {}
    22	
    23	    public Item(String subject, String message, List<String> to, String phone) {
    24	      this.subject = subject;
    25	      this.message = message;
    26	      this.to = to;
    27	      this.phone = phone;
    28	      this.createdAt = Instant.now().toString();
    29	    }
    30	  }
    31	
    32	  private final List<Item> items = Collections.synchronizedList(new ArrayList<>());
    33	
    34	  public void add(Item i) {
    35	    items.add(0, i); // newest first
    36	    if (items.size() > 200) items.remove(items.size() - 1);
    37	  }
    38	
    39	  public List<Item> all() {
    40	    return new ArrayList<>(items);
    41	  }
    42	}

----- FILE: ./order-service/order-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/order/service/client/ProductClient.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.order.service.client;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.order.service.model.Product;
     4	import org.springframework.cloud.openfeign.FeignClient;
     5	import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.GetMapping;
     6	import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.PathVariable;
     7	
     8	@FeignClient(
     9	        name = "PRODUCT-SERVICE",
    10	        path = "/api/products",
    11	        fallback = ProductClientFallback.class
    12	)
    13	public interface ProductClient {
    14	
    15	    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    16	    Product getProductById(@PathVariable("id") Long id);
    17	}

----- FILE: ./order-service/order-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/order/service/client/ProductClientFallback.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.order.service.client;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.order.service.model.Product;
     4	import org.springframework.stereotype.Component;
     5	
     6	@Component
     7	public class ProductClientFallback implements ProductClient {
     8	
     9	    @Override
    10	    public Product getProductById(Long id) {
    11	        System.err.println("âš ï¸ Fallback triggered for product ID " + id);
    12	        return new Product(
    13	                id,
    14	                "Unknown Product",
    15	                "Fallback - product service unavailable",
    16	                0.0,
    17	                0
    18	        );
    19	    }
    20	}

----- FILE: ./order-service/order-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/order/service/config/RabbitMQConfig.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.order.service.config;
     2	
     3	import org.springframework.amqp.core.Binding;
     4	import org.springframework.amqp.core.BindingBuilder;
     5	import org.springframework.amqp.core.DirectExchange;
     6	import org.springframework.amqp.core.Queue;
     7	import org.springframework.context.annotation.Bean;
     8	import org.springframework.context.annotation.Configuration;
     9	
    10	@Configuration
    11	public class RabbitMQConfig {
    12	
    13	    public static final String EXCHANGE_NAME = "notificationExchange";
    14	    public static final String QUEUE_NAME = "notificationQueue";
    15	
    16	    @Bean
    17	    public Queue notificationQueue() {
    18	        return new Queue(QUEUE_NAME, true);
    19	    }
    20	
    21	    @Bean
    22	    public DirectExchange notificationExchange() {
    23	        return new DirectExchange(EXCHANGE_NAME);
    24	    }
    25	
    26	    @Bean
    27	    public Binding binding(Queue notificationQueue, DirectExchange notificationExchange) {
    28	        return BindingBuilder.bind(notificationQueue).to(notificationExchange).with(QUEUE_NAME);
    29	    }
    30	}

----- FILE: ./order-service/order-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/order/service/controller/OrderController.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.order.service.controller;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.order.service.model.Order;
     4	import com.ecommerce.order.service.service.OrderService;
     5	import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.*;
     6	import lombok.RequiredArgsConstructor;
     7	import java.util.List;
     8	
     9	@RestController
    10	@RequestMapping("/api/orders")
    11	@RequiredArgsConstructor
    12	public class OrderController {
    13	    private final OrderService orderService;
    14	
    15	    @GetMapping
    16	    public List<Order> getAllOrders() {
    17	        return orderService.getAllOrders();
    18	    }
    19	
    20	    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    21	    public Order getOrderById(@PathVariable Long id) {
    22	        return orderService.getOrderById(id);
    23	    }
    24	
    25	    @PostMapping
    26	    public Order createOrder(@RequestParam Long productId, @RequestParam Integer quantity) {
    27	        return orderService.createOrder(productId, quantity);
    28	    }
    29	
    30	    @DeleteMapping("/{id}")
    31	    public void deleteOrder(@PathVariable Long id) {
    32	        orderService.deleteOrder(id);
    33	    }
    34	}

     9	@AllArgsConstructor

----- FILE: ./order-service/order-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/order/service/model/Order.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.order.service.model;
     2	
     3	import jakarta.persistence.*;
     4	import lombok.*;
     5	
     6	@Entity
     7	@Data
     8	@AllArgsConstructor
     9	@NoArgsConstructor
    10	@Builder
    11	@Table(name = "orders")
    12	public class Order {
    13	    @Id
    14	    @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)
    15	    private Long id;
    16	
    17	    private Long productId;
    18	    private Integer quantity;
    19	    private Double totalPrice;
    20	    private String status;
    21	}

     2	
     3	import lombok.*;
     4	
     5	@Data
     6	@NoArgsConstructor
     7	@AllArgsConstructor
     8	@Builder
     9	public class Product {
    10	    private Long id;
    11	    private String name;
    12	    private String description;
    13	    private double price;
    14	    private int quantity;
    15	}

----- FILE: ./order-service/order-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/order/service/service/NotificationProducer.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.order.service.service;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.order.service.model.NotificationMessage;
     4	import org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.core.RabbitTemplate;
     5	import org.springframework.stereotype.Service;
     6	
     7	@Service
     8	public class NotificationProducer {
     9	
    10	    private final RabbitTemplate rabbitTemplate;
    11	
    12	    public NotificationProducer(RabbitTemplate rabbitTemplate) {
    13	        this.rabbitTemplate = rabbitTemplate;
    14	    }
    15	
    16	    public void sendNotification(NotificationMessage message) {
    17	        // The queue name must match NotificationService
    18	        rabbitTemplate.convertAndSend("notificationQueue", message);
    19	        System.out.println("ðŸ“¤ Notification message sent to RabbitMQ!");
    20	    }
    21	}

----- FILE: ./order-service/order-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/order/service/service/OrderService.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.order.service.service;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.order.service.client.ProductClient;
     4	import com.ecommerce.order.service.model.NotificationMessage;
     5	import com.ecommerce.order.service.model.Order;
     6	import com.ecommerce.order.service.model.Product;
     7	import com.ecommerce.order.service.repository.OrderRepository;
     8	import io.github.resilience4j.circuitbreaker.annotation.CircuitBreaker;
     9	import lombok.RequiredArgsConstructor;
    10	import org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.core.RabbitTemplate;
    11	import org.springframework.stereotype.Service;
    12	
    13	import java.util.List;
    14	
    15	@Service
    16	@RequiredArgsConstructor
    17	public class OrderService {
    18	
    19	    private final OrderRepository orderRepository;
    20	    private final ProductClient productClient;
    21	    private final RabbitTemplate rabbitTemplate;
    22	
    23	    public List<Order> getAllOrders() {
    24	        return orderRepository.findAll();
    25	    }
    26	
    27	    public Order getOrderById(Long id) {
    28	        return orderRepository.findById(id).orElse(null);
    29	    }
    30	
    31	    @CircuitBreaker(name = "productService", fallbackMethod = "fallbackCreateOrder")
    32	    public Order createOrder(Long productId, Integer quantity) {
    33	        Product product = productClient.getProductById(productId);
    34	
    35	        if (product == null || product.getQuantity() < quantity) {
    36	            throw new RuntimeException("Product not available");
    37	        }
    38	
    39	        double totalPrice = product.getPrice() * quantity;
    40	
    41	        Order order = Order.builder()
    42	                .productId(productId)
    43	                .quantity(quantity)
    44	                .totalPrice(totalPrice)
    45	                .status("CREATED")
    46	                .build();
    47	
    48	        Order savedOrder = orderRepository.save(order);
    49	
    50	        // âœ… Send notification message
    51	        try {
    52	            NotificationMessage notification = new NotificationMessage(
    53	                    List.of("ajanamehdi751@gmail.com"),
    54	                    "+212660553886",
    55	                    "ðŸ“¦ Your order #" + savedOrder.getId() + " has been created successfully!"
    56	            );
    57	
    58	            rabbitTemplate.convertAndSend(
    59	                    "notificationExchange",  // Exchange
    60	                    "notificationQueue",     // Routing key
    61	                    notification
    62	            );
    63	
    64	            System.out.println("ðŸ“¤ Sent notification message for order #" + savedOrder.getId());
    65	        } catch (Exception e) {
    66	            System.err.println("âš ï¸ Failed to send notification for order #" + savedOrder.getId() + ": " + e.getMessage());
    67	        }
    68	
    69	        return savedOrder;
    70	    }
    71	
    72	    // âœ… Fallback when product-service fails
    73	    public Order fallbackCreateOrder(Long productId, Integer quantity, Throwable t) {
    74	        System.err.println("âš ï¸ Fallback triggered for product ID " + productId + ": " + t.getMessage());
    75	
    76	        Order failedOrder = Order.builder()
    77	                .productId(productId)
    78	                .quantity(quantity)
    79	                .totalPrice(0.0)
    80	                .status("FAILED (Fallback triggered)")
    81	                .build();
    82	
    83	        Order savedOrder = orderRepository.save(failedOrder);
    84	
    85	        try {
    86	            NotificationMessage notification = new NotificationMessage(
    87	                    List.of("ajanamehdi751@gmail.com"),
    88	                    "+212660553886",
    89	                    "âš ï¸ Order #" + savedOrder.getId() + " failed to process (Fallback triggered)."
    90	            );
    91	
    92	            rabbitTemplate.convertAndSend(
    93	                    "notificationExchange",
    94	                    "notificationQueue",
    95	                    notification
    96	            );
    97	
    98	            System.out.println("ðŸ“¤ Sent fallback notification for order #" + savedOrder.getId());
    99	        } catch (Exception e) {
   100	            System.err.println("âš ï¸ Failed to send fallback notification: " + e.getMessage());
   101	        }
   102	
   103	        return savedOrder;
   104	    }
   105	
   106	    public void deleteOrder(Long id) {
   107	        orderRepository.deleteById(id);
   108	    }
   109	}

----- FILE: ./order-service/order-service/src/main/resources/application.yml -----
     1	server:
     2	  port: 8082
     3	
     4	spring:
     5	  main:
     6	    lazy-initialization: true
     7	  cloud:
     8	    openfeign:
     9	      discovery:
    10	        enabled: true
    11	    loadbalancer:
    12	      retry:
    13	        enabled: true
    14	  application:
    15	    name: ORDER-SERVICE
    16	    
    17	  datasource:
    18	    url: jdbc:postgresql://postgres:5432/ecommerce
    19	    username: postgres
    20	    password: postgres
    21	    driver-class-name: org.postgresql.Driver
    22	
    23	  jpa:
    24	    hibernate:
    25	      ddl-auto: update
    26	    show-sql: true
    27	
    28	  rabbitmq:
    29	    host: rabbitmq
    30	    port: 5672
    31	    username: guest
    32	    password: guest
    33	
    34	  config:
    35	    import: optional:configserver:http://config-server:8888
    36	
    37	eureka:
    38	  client:
    39	    serviceUrl:
    40	      defaultZone: http://eureka-server:8761/eureka/
    41	  instance:
    42	    preferIpAddress: true
    43	    hostname: order-service
    44	    nonSecurePort: 8082
    45	
    46	feign:
    47	  client:
    48	    config:
    49	      default:
    50	        connectTimeout: 5000
    51	        readTimeout: 5000
    52	
    53	resilience4j.circuitbreaker:
    54	  instances:
    55	    productService:
    56	      slidingWindowSize: 10
    57	      failureRateThreshold: 70
    58	      waitDurationInOpenState: 5s
    59	      permittedNumberOfCallsInHalfOpenState: 3
    60	      automaticTransitionFromOpenToHalfOpenEnabled: true
    61	
    62	resilience4j.retry:
    63	  instances:
    64	    productService:
    65	      maxAttempts: 3
    66	      waitDuration: 2s
    67	
    68	logging:
    69	  level:
    70	    com.ecommerce.order.service.client.ProductClient: DEBUG
    71	    org.springframework.cloud.openfeign: DEBUG
    72	    feign: DEBUG

    76	  instances:

----- FILE: ./payment-service/payment-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/payment/service/client/OrderClient.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.payment.service.client;
     2	
     3	import org.springframework.cloud.openfeign.FeignClient;
     4	import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.*;
     5	
     6	@FeignClient(name = "order-service")
     7	public interface OrderClient {
     8	  @PutMapping("/api/orders/{id}/status")
     9	  Object updateStatus(@PathVariable("id") Long id, @RequestBody StatusReq req);
    10	
    11	  record StatusReq(String status) {}
    12	}
    13	

----- FILE: ./payment-service/payment-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/payment/service/config/RabbitMQConfig.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.payment.service.config;
     2	
     3	import org.springframework.amqp.core.*;
     4	import org.springframework.context.annotation.Bean;
     5	import org.springframework.context.annotation.Configuration;
     6	
     7	@Configuration
     8	public class RabbitMQConfig {
     9	
    10	  @Bean
    11	  public DirectExchange notificationExchange() {
    12	    return new DirectExchange("notificationExchange");
    13	  }
    14	
    15	  @Bean
    16	  public Queue notificationQueue() {
    17	    return new Queue("notificationQueue", true);
    18	  }
    19	
    20	  @Bean
    21	  public Binding binding(Queue notificationQueue, DirectExchange notificationExchange) {
    22	    return BindingBuilder.bind(notificationQueue).to(notificationExchange).with("notificationQueue");
    23	  }
    24	}
    25	

----- FILE: ./payment-service/payment-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/payment/service/controller/PaymentController.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.payment.service.controller;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.payment.service.dto.PaymentRequest;
     4	import com.ecommerce.payment.service.model.Payment;
     5	import com.ecommerce.payment.service.service.PaymentService;
     6	import jakarta.validation.Valid;
     7	import org.springframework.http.HttpStatus;
     8	import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.*;
     9	
    10	import java.util.List;
    11	
    12	@RestController
    13	@RequestMapping("/api/payments")
    14	public class PaymentController {
    15	
    16	  private final PaymentService service;
    17	
    18	  public PaymentController(PaymentService service) {
    19	    this.service = service;
    20	  }
    21	
    22	  @GetMapping
    23	  public List<Payment> all() { return service.all(); }
    24	
    25	  @GetMapping("/by-order/{orderId}")
    26	  public List<Payment> byOrder(@PathVariable Long orderId) { return service.byOrder(orderId); }
    27	
    28	  @PostMapping
    29	  @ResponseStatus(HttpStatus.CREATED)
    30	  public Payment pay(@Valid @RequestBody PaymentRequest req) {
    31	    return service.pay(req.orderId(), req.amount(), req.method());
    32	  }
    33	}
    34	

----- FILE: ./payment-service/payment-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/payment/service/dto/PaymentRequest.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.payment.service.dto;
     2	
     3	import jakarta.validation.constraints.Min;
     4	import jakarta.validation.constraints.NotBlank;
     5	import jakarta.validation.constraints.NotNull;
     6	
     7	public record PaymentRequest(
     8	  @NotNull Long orderId,
     9	  @NotNull @Min(0) Double amount,
    10	  @NotBlank String method
    11	) {}
    12	

----- FILE: ./payment-service/payment-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/payment/service/model/Payment.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.payment.service.model;
     2	
     3	import jakarta.persistence.*;
     4	import lombok.*;
     5	
     6	import java.time.Instant;
     7	
     8	@Entity
     9	@Table(name = "payments")
    10	@Getter @Setter @NoArgsConstructor @AllArgsConstructor @Builder
    11	public class Payment {
    12	  @Id
    13	  @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)
    14	  private Long id;
    15	
    16	  @Column(nullable = false)
    17	  private Long orderId;
    18	
    19	  @Column(nullable = false)
    20	  private Double amount;
    21	
    22	  @Column(nullable = false)
    23	  private String method; // CARD/CASH...
    24	
    25	  @Column(nullable = false)
    26	  private String status; // PAID/FAILED
    27	
    28	  @Column(nullable = false)
    29	  private Instant createdAt;
    30	}
    31	

----- FILE: ./payment-service/payment-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/payment/service/repository/PaymentRepository.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.payment.service.repository;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.payment.service.model.Payment;
     4	import org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository;
     5	
     6	import java.util.List;
     7	
     8	public interface PaymentRepository extends JpaRepository<Payment, Long> {
     9	  List<Payment> findByOrderId(Long orderId);
    10	}
    11	

----- FILE: ./payment-service/payment-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/payment/service/service/PaymentService.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.payment.service.service;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.payment.service.client.OrderClient;
     4	import com.ecommerce.payment.service.model.Payment;
     5	import com.ecommerce.payment.service.repository.PaymentRepository;
     6	import lombok.RequiredArgsConstructor;
     7	import org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.core.RabbitTemplate;
     8	import org.springframework.stereotype.Service;
     9	
    10	import java.time.Instant;
    11	import java.util.List;
    12	
    13	@Service
    14	@RequiredArgsConstructor
    15	public class PaymentService {
    16	
    17	  private final PaymentRepository repo;
    18	  private final OrderClient orderClient;
    19	  private final RabbitTemplate rabbitTemplate;
    20	
    21	  public Payment pay(Long orderId, Double amount, String method) {
    22	    // 1) save payment
    23	    Payment p = Payment.builder()
    24	      .orderId(orderId)
    25	      .amount(amount)
    26	      .method(method)
    27	      .status("PAID")
    28	      .createdAt(Instant.now())
    29	      .build();
    30	    Payment saved = repo.save(p);
    31	
    32	    // 2) update order status -> PAID
    33	    try {
    34	      orderClient.updateStatus(orderId, new OrderClient.StatusReq("PAID"));
    35	    } catch (Exception e) {
    36	      // don't fail payment, but mark info in logs
    37	      System.err.println("âš ï¸ Failed to update order status for orderId=" + orderId + ": " + e.getMessage());
    38	    }
    39	
    40	    // 3) async notification (email/sms simulated by your notification-service)
    41	    try {
    42	      NotificationMessage msg = new NotificationMessage(
    43	        List.of("admin@demo.com"), // keep simple for demo (you can replace later)
    44	        "+212000000000",
    45	        "âœ… Payment received for Order #" + orderId + " (amount=" + amount + ", method=" + method + ")"
    46	      );
    47	
    48	      rabbitTemplate.convertAndSend(
    49	        "notificationExchange",
    50	        "notificationQueue",
    51	        msg
    52	      );
    53	    } catch (Exception e) {
    54	      System.err.println("âš ï¸ Failed to send payment notification: " + e.getMessage());
    55	    }
    56	
    57	    return saved;
    58	  }
    59	
    60	  public java.util.List<Payment> all() { return repo.findAll(); }
    61	  public java.util.List<Payment> byOrder(Long orderId) { return repo.findByOrderId(orderId); }
    62	
    63	  public record NotificationMessage(java.util.List<String> toList, String phone, String text) {}
    64	}
    65	

----- FILE: ./payment-service/payment-service/src/main/resources/application.yml -----
     1	server:
     2	  port: 8086
     3	
     4	spring:
     5	  application:
     6	    name: payment-service
     7	  datasource:
     8	    url: jdbc:postgresql://postgres:5432/ecommerce
     9	    username: postgres
    10	    password: postgres
    11	    driver-class-name: org.postgresql.Driver
    12	  jpa:
    13	    hibernate:
    14	      ddl-auto: update
    15	    show-sql: false
    16	  config:
    17	    import: optional:configserver:http://config-server:8888
    18	
    19	eureka:
    20	  client:
    21	    serviceUrl:
    22	      defaultZone: http://eureka-server:8761/eureka/
    23	  instance:
    24	    preferIpAddress: true
    25	
    26	management:
    27	  endpoints:
    28	    web:
    29	      exposure:
    30	        include: '*'

----- FILE: ./product-service/product-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/product/service/MainApplication.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.product.service;
     2	
     3	import org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication;
     4	import org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.SpringBootApplication;
     5	import org.springframework.cloud.client.discovery.EnableDiscoveryClient;
     6	import org.springframework.cloud.openfeign.EnableFeignClients;
     7	
     8	@SpringBootApplication
     9	@EnableDiscoveryClient
    10	@EnableFeignClients
    11	public class MainApplication {

    14	    }
