----- FILE: ./product-service/product-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/product/service/controller/ProductController.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.product.service.controller;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.product.service.model.Product;
     4	import com.ecommerce.product.service.service.ProductService;
     5	
     6	import org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity;
     7	import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.*;
     8	import java.util.List;
     9	
    10	@RestController
    11	@RequestMapping("/api/products")
    12	public class ProductController {
    13	
    14	    private final ProductService productService;
    15	
    16	    public ProductController(ProductService productService) {
    17	        this.productService = productService;
    18	    }
    19	
    20	    @GetMapping
    21	    public List<Product> getAllProducts() {
    22	        return productService.getAllProducts();
    23	    }
    24	
    25	    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    26	    public ResponseEntity<Product> getProductById(@PathVariable Long id) {
    27	        return productService.getProductById(id)
    28	                .map(ResponseEntity::ok)
    29	                .orElse(ResponseEntity.notFound().build());
    30	    }
    31	
    32	
    33	    @PostMapping
    34	    public Product createProduct(@RequestBody Product product) {
    35	        return productService.createProduct(product);
    36	    }
    37	
    38	    @PutMapping("/{id}")
    39	    public Product updateProduct(@PathVariable Long id, @RequestBody Product product) {
    40	        return productService.updateProduct(id, product).orElse(null);
    41	    }
    42	
    43	    @DeleteMapping("/{id}")
    44	    public void deleteProduct(@PathVariable Long id) {
    45	        productService.deleteProduct(id);
    46	    }
    47	}

----- FILE: ./product-service/product-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/product/service/model/Product.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.product.service.model;
     2	
     3	import jakarta.persistence.*;
     4	import lombok.*;
     5	
     6	@Entity
     7	@Data
     8	@NoArgsConstructor
     9	@AllArgsConstructor
    10	@Builder
    11	public class Product {
    12	    @Id
    13	    @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)
    14	    private Long id;
    15	
    16	    private String name;
    17	    private String description;
    18	    private double price;
    19	    private int quantity;
    20	}

----- FILE: ./product-service/product-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/product/service/repository/ProductRepository.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.product.service.repository;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.product.service.model.Product;
     4	import org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository;
     5	import org.springframework.stereotype.Repository;
     6	
     7	@Repository
     8	public interface ProductRepository extends JpaRepository<Product, Long> {
     9	}

----- FILE: ./product-service/product-service/src/main/java/com/ecommerce/product/service/service/ProductService.java -----
     1	package com.ecommerce.product.service.service;
     2	
     3	import com.ecommerce.product.service.model.Product;
     4	import com.ecommerce.product.service.repository.ProductRepository;
     5	import org.springframework.stereotype.Service;
     6	import java.util.List;
     7	import java.util.Optional;
     8	
     9	@Service
    10	public class ProductService {
    11	
    12	    private final ProductRepository productRepository;
    13	
    14	    public ProductService(ProductRepository productRepository) {
    15	        this.productRepository = productRepository;
    16	    }
    17	
    18	    public List<Product> getAllProducts() {
    19	        return productRepository.findAll();
    20	    }
    21	
    22	    public Optional<Product> getProductById(Long id) {
    23	        return productRepository.findById(id);
    24	    }
    25	
    26	    public Product createProduct(Product product) {
    27	        return productRepository.save(product);
    28	    }
    29	
    30	    public Optional<Product> updateProduct(Long id, Product updatedProduct) {
    31	        return productRepository.findById(id).map(existing -> {
    32	            existing.setName(updatedProduct.getName());
    33	            existing.setDescription(updatedProduct.getDescription());
    34	            existing.setPrice(updatedProduct.getPrice());
    35	            existing.setQuantity(updatedProduct.getQuantity());
    36	            return productRepository.save(existing);
    37	        });
    38	    }
    39	
    40	    public void deleteProduct(Long id) {
    41	        productRepository.deleteById(id);
    42	    }
    43	}

----- FILE: ./product-service/product-service/src/main/resources/application.yml -----
     1	server:
     2	  port: 8081
     3	
     4	spring:
     5	  application:

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/.claude/CLAUDE.md -----
     1	
     2	You are an expert in TypeScript, Angular, and scalable web application development. You write functional, maintainable, performant, and accessible code following Angular and TypeScript best practices.
     3	
     4	## TypeScript Best Practices
     5	
     6	- Use strict type checking
     7	- Prefer type inference when the type is obvious
     8	- Avoid the `any` type; use `unknown` when type is uncertain
     9	
    10	## Angular Best Practices
    11	
    12	- Always use standalone components over NgModules
    13	- Must NOT set `standalone: true` inside Angular decorators. It's the default in Angular v20+.
    14	- Use signals for state management
    15	- Implement lazy loading for feature routes
    16	- Do NOT use the `@HostBinding` and `@HostListener` decorators. Put host bindings inside the `host` object of the `@Component` or `@Directive` decorator instead
    17	- Use `NgOptimizedImage` for all static images.
    18	  - `NgOptimizedImage` does not work for inline base64 images.
    19	
    20	## Accessibility Requirements
    21	
    22	- It MUST pass all AXE checks.
    23	- It MUST follow all WCAG AA minimums, including focus management, color contrast, and ARIA attributes.
    24	
    25	### Components
    26	
    27	- Keep components small and focused on a single responsibility
    28	- Use `input()` and `output()` functions instead of decorators
    29	- Use `computed()` for derived state
    30	- Set `changeDetection: ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush` in `@Component` decorator
    31	- Prefer inline templates for small components
    32	- Prefer Reactive forms instead of Template-driven ones
    33	- Do NOT use `ngClass`, use `class` bindings instead
    34	- Do NOT use `ngStyle`, use `style` bindings instead
    35	- When using external templates/styles, use paths relative to the component TS file.
    36	
    37	## State Management
    38	
    39	- Use signals for local component state
    40	- Use `computed()` for derived state
    41	- Keep state transformations pure and predictable
    42	- Do NOT use `mutate` on signals, use `update` or `set` instead
    43	
    44	## Templates
    45	
    46	- Keep templates simple and avoid complex logic
    47	- Use native control flow (`@if`, `@for`, `@switch`) instead of `*ngIf`, `*ngFor`, `*ngSwitch`
    48	- Use the async pipe to handle observables
    49	- Do not assume globals like (`new Date()`) are available.
    50	- Do not write arrow functions in templates (they are not supported).
    51	
    52	## Services
    53	
    54	- Design services around a single responsibility
    55	- Use the `providedIn: 'root'` option for singleton services
    56	- Use the `inject()` function instead of constructor injection

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/.gemini/GEMINI.md -----
     1	
     2	You are an expert in TypeScript, Angular, and scalable web application development. You write functional, maintainable, performant, and accessible code following Angular and TypeScript best practices.
     3	
     4	## TypeScript Best Practices
     5	
     6	- Use strict type checking
     7	- Prefer type inference when the type is obvious
     8	- Avoid the `any` type; use `unknown` when type is uncertain
     9	
    10	## Angular Best Practices
    11	
    12	- Always use standalone components over NgModules
    13	- Must NOT set `standalone: true` inside Angular decorators. It's the default in Angular v20+.
    14	- Use signals for state management
    15	- Implement lazy loading for feature routes
    16	- Do NOT use the `@HostBinding` and `@HostListener` decorators. Put host bindings inside the `host` object of the `@Component` or `@Directive` decorator instead
    17	- Use `NgOptimizedImage` for all static images.
    18	  - `NgOptimizedImage` does not work for inline base64 images.
    19	
    20	## Accessibility Requirements
    21	
    22	- It MUST pass all AXE checks.
    23	- It MUST follow all WCAG AA minimums, including focus management, color contrast, and ARIA attributes.
    24	
    25	### Components
    26	
    27	- Keep components small and focused on a single responsibility
    28	- Use `input()` and `output()` functions instead of decorators
    29	- Use `computed()` for derived state
    30	- Set `changeDetection: ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush` in `@Component` decorator
    31	- Prefer inline templates for small components
    32	- Prefer Reactive forms instead of Template-driven ones
    33	- Do NOT use `ngClass`, use `class` bindings instead
    34	- Do NOT use `ngStyle`, use `style` bindings instead
    35	- When using external templates/styles, use paths relative to the component TS file.
    36	
    37	## State Management
    38	
    39	- Use signals for local component state
    40	- Use `computed()` for derived state
    41	- Keep state transformations pure and predictable
    42	- Do NOT use `mutate` on signals, use `update` or `set` instead
    43	
    44	## Templates
    45	
    46	- Keep templates simple and avoid complex logic
    47	- Use native control flow (`@if`, `@for`, `@switch`) instead of `*ngIf`, `*ngFor`, `*ngSwitch`
    48	- Use the async pipe to handle observables
    49	- Do not assume globals like (`new Date()`) are available.
    50	- Do not write arrow functions in templates (they are not supported).
    51	
    52	## Services
    53	
    54	- Design services around a single responsibility
    55	- Use the `providedIn: 'root'` option for singleton services
    56	- Use the `inject()` function instead of constructor injection

     1	
     2	You are an expert in TypeScript, Angular, and scalable web application development. You write functional, maintainable, performant, and accessible code following Angular and TypeScript best practices.
     3	
     4	## TypeScript Best Practices
     5	
     6	- Use strict type checking
     7	- Prefer type inference when the type is obvious
     8	- Avoid the `any` type; use `unknown` when type is uncertain
     9	
    10	## Angular Best Practices
    11	
    12	- Always use standalone components over NgModules

    14	- Use signals for state management
    15	- Implement lazy loading for feature routes
    16	- Do NOT use the `@HostBinding` and `@HostListener` decorators. Put host bindings inside the `host` object of the `@Component` or `@Directive` decorator instead

    18	  - `NgOptimizedImage` does not work for inline base64 images.
    19

    23	- It MUST follow all WCAG AA minimums, including focus management, color contrast, and ARIA attributes.

    32	- Prefer Reactive forms instead of Template-driven ones
    33	- Do NOT use `ngClass`, use `class` bindings instead
    34	- Do NOT use `ngStyle`, use `style` bindings instead

    55	- Use the `providedIn: 'root'` option for singleton services
    56	- Use the `inject()` function instead of constructor injection

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/.junie/guidelines.md -----
     1	
     2	You are an expert in TypeScript, Angular, and scalable web application development. You write functional, maintainable, performant, and accessible code following Angular and TypeScript best practices.
     3	
     4	## TypeScript Best Practices
     5	
     6	- Use strict type checking
     7	- Prefer type inference when the type is obvious
     8	- Avoid the `any` type; use `unknown` when type is uncertain
     9	
    10	## Angular Best Practices
    11	
    12	- Always use standalone components over NgModules
    13	- Must NOT set `standalone: true` inside Angular decorators. It's the default in Angular v20+.
    14	- Use signals for state management
    15	- Implement lazy loading for feature routes
    16	- Do NOT use the `@HostBinding` and `@HostListener` decorators. Put host bindings inside the `host` object of the `@Component` or `@Directive` decorator instead
    17	- Use `NgOptimizedImage` for all static images.
    18	  - `NgOptimizedImage` does not work for inline base64 images.
    19	
    20	## Accessibility Requirements
    21	
    22	- It MUST pass all AXE checks.
    23	- It MUST follow all WCAG AA minimums, including focus management, color contrast, and ARIA attributes.
    24	
    25	### Components
    26	
    27	- Keep components small and focused on a single responsibility
    28	- Use `input()` and `output()` functions instead of decorators
    29	- Use `computed()` for derived state
    30	- Set `changeDetection: ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush` in `@Component` decorator
    31	- Prefer inline templates for small components
    32	- Prefer Reactive forms instead of Template-driven ones
    33	- Do NOT use `ngClass`, use `class` bindings instead
    34	- Do NOT use `ngStyle`, use `style` bindings instead
    35	- When using external templates/styles, use paths relative to the component TS file.
    36	
    37	## State Management
    38	
    39	- Use signals for local component state
    40	- Use `computed()` for derived state
    41	- Keep state transformations pure and predictable
    42	- Do NOT use `mutate` on signals, use `update` or `set` instead
    43	
    44	## Templates
    45	
    46	- Keep templates simple and avoid complex logic
    47	- Use native control flow (`@if`, `@for`, `@switch`) instead of `*ngIf`, `*ngFor`, `*ngSwitch`
    48	- Use the async pipe to handle observables
    49	- Do not assume globals like (`new Date()`) are available.
    50	- Do not write arrow functions in templates (they are not supported).
    51	
    52	## Services
    53	
    54	- Design services around a single responsibility
    55	- Use the `providedIn: 'root'` option for singleton services
    56	- Use the `inject()` function instead of constructor injection

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/.windsurf/rules/guidelines.md -----
     1	
     2	You are an expert in TypeScript, Angular, and scalable web application development. You write functional, maintainable, performant, and accessible code following Angular and TypeScript best practices.
     3	
     4	## TypeScript Best Practices
     5	
     6	- Use strict type checking
     7	- Prefer type inference when the type is obvious
     8	- Avoid the `any` type; use `unknown` when type is uncertain
     9	
    10	## Angular Best Practices
    11	
    12	- Always use standalone components over NgModules
    13	- Must NOT set `standalone: true` inside Angular decorators. It's the default in Angular v20+.
    14	- Use signals for state management
    15	- Implement lazy loading for feature routes
    16	- Do NOT use the `@HostBinding` and `@HostListener` decorators. Put host bindings inside the `host` object of the `@Component` or `@Directive` decorator instead
    17	- Use `NgOptimizedImage` for all static images.
    18	  - `NgOptimizedImage` does not work for inline base64 images.
    19	
    20	## Accessibility Requirements
    21	
    22	- It MUST pass all AXE checks.
    23	- It MUST follow all WCAG AA minimums, including focus management, color contrast, and ARIA attributes.
    24	
    25	### Components
    26	
    27	- Keep components small and focused on a single responsibility
    28	- Use `input()` and `output()` functions instead of decorators
    29	- Use `computed()` for derived state
    30	- Set `changeDetection: ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush` in `@Component` decorator
    31	- Prefer inline templates for small components
    32	- Prefer Reactive forms instead of Template-driven ones
    33	- Do NOT use `ngClass`, use `class` bindings instead
    34	- Do NOT use `ngStyle`, use `style` bindings instead
    35	- When using external templates/styles, use paths relative to the component TS file.
    36	
    37	## State Management
    38	
    39	- Use signals for local component state
    40	- Use `computed()` for derived state
    41	- Keep state transformations pure and predictable
    42	- Do NOT use `mutate` on signals, use `update` or `set` instead
    43	
    44	## Templates
    45	
    46	- Keep templates simple and avoid complex logic
    47	- Use native control flow (`@if`, `@for`, `@switch`) instead of `*ngIf`, `*ngFor`, `*ngSwitch`
    48	- Use the async pipe to handle observables
    49	- Do not assume globals like (`new Date()`) are available.
    50	- Do not write arrow functions in templates (they are not supported).
    51	
    52	## Services
    53	
    54	- Design services around a single responsibility
    55	- Use the `providedIn: 'root'` option for singleton services
    56	- Use the `inject()` function instead of constructor injection

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/AGENTS.md -----
     1	
     2	You are an expert in TypeScript, Angular, and scalable web application development. You write functional, maintainable, performant, and accessible code following Angular and TypeScript best practices.
     3	
     4	## TypeScript Best Practices
     5	
     6	- Use strict type checking
     7	- Prefer type inference when the type is obvious
     8	- Avoid the `any` type; use `unknown` when type is uncertain
     9	
    10	## Angular Best Practices
    11	
    12	- Always use standalone components over NgModules
    13	- Must NOT set `standalone: true` inside Angular decorators. It's the default in Angular v20+.
    14	- Use signals for state management
    15	- Implement lazy loading for feature routes
    16	- Do NOT use the `@HostBinding` and `@HostListener` decorators. Put host bindings inside the `host` object of the `@Component` or `@Directive` decorator instead
    17	- Use `NgOptimizedImage` for all static images.
    18	  - `NgOptimizedImage` does not work for inline base64 images.
    19	
    20	## Accessibility Requirements
    21	
    22	- It MUST pass all AXE checks.
    23	- It MUST follow all WCAG AA minimums, including focus management, color contrast, and ARIA attributes.
    24	
    25	### Components
    26	
    27	- Keep components small and focused on a single responsibility
    28	- Use `input()` and `output()` functions instead of decorators
    29	- Use `computed()` for derived state
    30	- Set `changeDetection: ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush` in `@Component` decorator
    31	- Prefer inline templates for small components
    32	- Prefer Reactive forms instead of Template-driven ones
    33	- Do NOT use `ngClass`, use `class` bindings instead
    34	- Do NOT use `ngStyle`, use `style` bindings instead
    35	- When using external templates/styles, use paths relative to the component TS file.
    36	
    37	## State Management
    38	
    39	- Use signals for local component state
    40	- Use `computed()` for derived state
    41	- Keep state transformations pure and predictable
    42	- Do NOT use `mutate` on signals, use `update` or `set` instead
    43	
    44	## Templates
    45	
    46	- Keep templates simple and avoid complex logic
    47	- Use native control flow (`@if`, `@for`, `@switch`) instead of `*ngIf`, `*ngFor`, `*ngSwitch`
    48	- Use the async pipe to handle observables
    49	- Do not assume globals like (`new Date()`) are available.
    50	- Do not write arrow functions in templates (they are not supported).
    51	
    52	## Services
    53	
    54	- Design services around a single responsibility
    55	- Use the `providedIn: 'root'` option for singleton services
    56	- Use the `inject()` function instead of constructor injection

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/README.md -----
     1	# EcommerceDashboard
     2	
     3	This project was generated using [Angular CLI](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli) version 21.0.4.
     4	
     5	## Development server
     6	
     7	To start a local development server, run:
     8	
     9	```bash
    10	ng serve
    11	```
    12	
    13	Once the server is running, open your browser and navigate to `http://localhost:4200/`. The application will automatically reload whenever you modify any of the source files.
    14	
    15	## Code scaffolding
    16	
    17	Angular CLI includes powerful code scaffolding tools. To generate a new component, run:
    18	
    19	```bash
    20	ng generate component component-name
    21	```
    22	
    23	For a complete list of available schematics (such as `components`, `directives`, or `pipes`), run:
    24	
    25	```bash
    26	ng generate --help
    27	```
    28	
    29	## Building
    30	
    31	To build the project run:
    32	
    33	```bash
    34	ng build
    35	```
    36	
    37	This will compile your project and store the build artifacts in the `dist/` directory. By default, the production build optimizes your application for performance and speed.
    38	
    39	## Running unit tests
    40	
    41	To execute unit tests with the [Vitest](https://vitest.dev/) test runner, use the following command:
    42	
    43	```bash
    44	ng test
    45	```
    46	
    47	## Running end-to-end tests
    48	
    49	For end-to-end (e2e) testing, run:
    50	
    51	```bash
    52	ng e2e
    53	```
    54	
    55	Angular CLI does not come with an end-to-end testing framework by default. You can choose one that suits your needs.
    56	
    57	## Additional Resources
    58	
    59	For more information on using the Angular CLI, including detailed command references, visit the [Angular CLI Overview and Command Reference](https://angular.dev/tools/cli) page.

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/src/app/api/api.models.ts -----
     1	export interface Product {
     2	  id?: number;
     3	  name: string;
     4	  description?: string;
     5	  price: number;
     6	  stock?: number;
     7	}
     8	
     9	export interface Client {
    10	  id?: number;
    11	  fullName: string;
    12	  email: string;
    13	  phone?: string;
    14	}
    15	
    16	export type OrderStatus = 'CREATED' | 'PAID' | 'SHIPPED' | 'CANCELLED';
    17	
    18	export interface Order {
    19	  id?: number;
    20	  clientId: number;
    21	  productId: number;
    22	  quantity: number;
    23	  status?: OrderStatus;
    24	}
    25	
    26	export interface NotificationMessage {
    27	  id?: number;
    28	  to?: string;
    29	  subject?: string;
    30	  text?: string;
    31	  createdAt?: string;
    32	}
    33	
    34	export interface Payment {
    35	  id?: number;
    36	  orderId: number;
    37	  amount: number;
    38	  method: string;   // CARD/CASH/...
    39	  status?: string;  // PAID/FAILED/...
    40	  createdAt?: string;
    41	}

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/src/app/api/clients.api.ts -----
     1	import { Injectable } from '@angular/core';
     2	import { HttpClient } from '@angular/common/http';
     3	import { Client } from './api.models';
     4	
     5	@Injectable({ providedIn: 'root' })
     6	export class ClientsApi {
     7	  private base = '/api/clients';
     8	
     9	  constructor(private http: HttpClient) {}
    10	
    11	  list() { return this.http.get<Client[]>(this.base); }
    12	  create(c: Client) { return this.http.post<Client>(this.base, c); }
    13	  delete(id: number) { return this.http.delete<void>(`${this.base}/${id}`); }
    14	}

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/src/app/api/notifications.api.ts -----
     1	import { Injectable } from '@angular/core';
     2	import { HttpClient } from '@angular/common/http';
     3	import { NotificationMessage } from './api.models';
     4	
     5	@Injectable({ providedIn: 'root' })
     6	export class NotificationsApi {
     7	  private base = '/api/notifications';
     8	
     9	  constructor(private http: HttpClient) {}
    10	
    11	  list() { return this.http.get<NotificationMessage[]>(this.base); }
    12	}

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/src/app/api/orders.api.ts -----
     1	import { Injectable } from '@angular/core';
     2	import { HttpClient, HttpParams } from '@angular/common/http';
     3	import { Order } from './api.models';
     4	
     5	@Injectable({ providedIn: 'root' })
     6	export class OrdersApi {
     7	  private base = '/api/orders';
     8	
     9	  constructor(private http: HttpClient) {}
    10	
    11	  list() { return this.http.get<Order[]>(this.base); }
    12	
    13	  // âœ… match backend: POST /api/orders?productId=...&quantity=...
    14	  create(productId: number, quantity: number) {
    15	    const params = new HttpParams()
    16	      .set('productId', String(productId))
    17	      .set('quantity', String(quantity));
    18	    return this.http.post<Order>(this.base, null, { params });
    19	  }
    20	
    21	  delete(id: number) { return this.http.delete<void>(`${this.base}/${id}`); }
    22	}

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/src/app/api/payments.api.ts -----
     1	import { Injectable } from '@angular/core';
     2	import { HttpClient } from '@angular/common/http';
     3	import { Payment } from './api.models';
     4	
     5	@Injectable({ providedIn: 'root' })
     6	export class PaymentsApi {
     7	  private base = '/api/payments';
     8	
     9	  constructor(private http: HttpClient) {}
    10	
    11	  list() { return this.http.get<Payment[]>(this.base); }
    12	
    13	  create(p: { orderId: number; amount: number; method: string }) {
    14	    return this.http.post<Payment>(this.base, p);
    15	  }
    16	
    17	  byOrder(orderId: number) {
    18	    return this.http.get<Payment[]>(`${this.base}/by-order/${orderId}`);
    19	  }
    20	}

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/src/app/api/products.api.ts -----
     1	import { Injectable } from '@angular/core';
     2	import { HttpClient } from '@angular/common/http';
     3	import { Product } from './api.models';
     4	
     5	@Injectable({ providedIn: 'root' })
     6	export class ProductsApi {
     7	  private base = '/api/products';
     8	
     9	  constructor(private http: HttpClient) {}
    10	
    11	  list() { return this.http.get<Product[]>(this.base); }
    12	  create(p: Product) { return this.http.post<Product>(this.base, p); }
    13	  delete(id: number) { return this.http.delete<void>(`${this.base}/${id}`); }
    14	}

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/src/app/app.config.server.ts -----
     1	import { mergeApplicationConfig, ApplicationConfig } from '@angular/core';
     2	import { provideServerRendering, withRoutes } from '@angular/ssr';
     3	import { appConfig } from './app.config';
     4	import { serverRoutes } from './app.routes.server';
     5	
     6	const serverConfig: ApplicationConfig = {
     7	  providers: [
     8	    provideServerRendering(withRoutes(serverRoutes))
     9	  ]
    10	};
    11	
    12	export const config = mergeApplicationConfig(appConfig, serverConfig);

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/src/app/app.routes.server.ts -----
     1	import { RenderMode, ServerRoute } from '@angular/ssr';
     2	
     3	export const serverRoutes: ServerRoute[] = [
     4	  {
     5	    path: '**',
     6	    renderMode: RenderMode.Prerender
     7	  }
     8	];

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/src/app/app.routes.ts -----
     1	import { Routes } from '@angular/router';
     2	import { authGuard } from './core/guards/auth.guard';
     3	
     4	import { LoginComponent } from './ui/login/login.component';
     5	import { ShellComponent } from './ui/layout/shell.component';
     6	import { DashboardComponent } from './ui/dashboard/dashboard.component';
     7	import { ProductsComponent } from './ui/products/products.component';
     8	import { OrdersComponent } from './ui/orders/orders.component';
     9	import { ClientsComponent } from './ui/clients/clients.component';
    10	import { NotificationsComponent } from './ui/notifications/notifications.component';
    11	
    12	export const routes: Routes = [
    13	  { path: '', pathMatch: 'full', redirectTo: 'login' },
    14	
    15	  { path: 'login', component: LoginComponent },
    16	
    17	  {
    18	    path: 'app',
    19	    component: ShellComponent,
    20	    canActivate: [authGuard],
    21	    children: [
    22	      { path: 'payments', loadComponent: () => import('./ui/payments/payments.component').then(m => m.PaymentsComponent) },
    23	
    24	      { path: '', pathMatch: 'full', redirectTo: 'dashboard' },
    25	      { path: 'dashboard', component: DashboardComponent },
    26	      { path: 'products', component: ProductsComponent },
    27	      { path: 'orders', component: OrdersComponent },
    28	      { path: 'clients', component: ClientsComponent },
    29	      { path: 'notifications', component: NotificationsComponent }
    30	    ]
    31	  },
    32	
    33	  { path: '**', redirectTo: 'login' }
    34	];

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/src/app/core/auth/auth.models.ts -----
     1	export type Role = 'ADMIN' | 'USER';
     2	
     3	export interface LoginRequest {
     4	  email: string;
     5	  password: string;
     6	}
     7	
     8	export interface AuthUser {
     9	  email: string;
    10	  role: Role;
    11	  token: string; // fake token for now
    12	}

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/src/app/core/auth/auth.service.ts -----
     1	import { Injectable, signal, computed } from '@angular/core';
     2	import { AuthUser, LoginRequest, Role } from './auth.models';
     3	
     4	const STORAGE_KEY = 'auth_user';
     5	
     6	@Injectable({ providedIn: 'root' })
     7	export class AuthService {
     8	  private _user = signal<AuthUser | null>(this.readFromStorage());
     9	
    10	  user = computed(() => this._user());
    11	  isLoggedIn = computed(() => !!this._user());
    12	
    13	  login(payload: LoginRequest) {
    14	    // Fake auth for now (until you implement real auth in backend)
    15	    // Rule: if email contains "admin" => ADMIN else USER
    16	    const role: Role = payload.email.toLowerCase().includes('admin') ? 'ADMIN' : 'USER';
    17	
    18	    const user: AuthUser = {
    19	      email: payload.email.trim(),
    20	      role,
    21	      token: 'fake-jwt-token'
    22	    };
    23	
    24	    localStorage.setItem(STORAGE_KEY, JSON.stringify(user));
    25	    this._user.set(user);
    26	  }
    27	
    28	  logout() {
    29	    localStorage.removeItem(STORAGE_KEY);
    30	    this._user.set(null);
    31	  }
    32	
    33	  hasRole(roles: Role[]) {
    34	    const u = this._user();
    35	    return !!u && roles.includes(u.role);
    36	  }
    37	
    38	  private readFromStorage(): AuthUser | null {
    39	    try {
    40	      const raw = localStorage.getItem(STORAGE_KEY);
    41	      return raw ? (JSON.parse(raw) as AuthUser) : null;
    42	    } catch {
    43	      return null;
    44	    }
    45	  }
    46	}

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/src/app/core/guards/auth.guard.ts -----
     1	import { CanActivateFn, Router } from '@angular/router';
     2	import { inject } from '@angular/core';
     3	import { AuthService } from '../auth/auth.service';
     4	
     5	export const authGuard: CanActivateFn = () => {
     6	  const auth = inject(AuthService);
     7	  const router = inject(Router);
     8	  if (auth.isLoggedIn()) return true;
     9	  router.navigateByUrl('/login');
    10	  return false;
    11	};

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/src/app/core/guards/role.guard.ts -----
     1	import { CanActivateFn, Router, ActivatedRouteSnapshot } from '@angular/router';
     2	import { inject } from '@angular/core';
     3	import { AuthService } from '../auth/auth.service';
     4	import { Role } from '../auth/auth.models';
     5	
     6	export const roleGuard: CanActivateFn = (route: ActivatedRouteSnapshot) => {
     7	  const auth = inject(AuthService);
     8	  const router = inject(Router);
     9	  const roles = (route.data['roles'] ?? []) as Role[];
    10	
    11	  if (!auth.isLoggedIn()) {
    12	    router.navigateByUrl('/login');
    13	    return false;
    14	  }
    15	  if (!roles.length || auth.hasRole(roles)) return true;
    16	
    17	  router.navigateByUrl('/app/dashboard');
    18	  return false;
    19	};

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/src/app/ui/clients/clients.component.ts -----
     1	import { Component, signal } from '@angular/core';
     2	import { CommonModule } from '@angular/common';
     3	import { FormsModule } from '@angular/forms';
     4	import { ClientsApi } from '../../api/clients.api';
     5	import { Client } from '../../api/api.models';
     6	
     7	import { MatCardModule } from '@angular/material/card';
     8	import { MatButtonModule } from '@angular/material/button';
     9	import { MatFormFieldModule } from '@angular/material/form-field';
    10	import { MatInputModule } from '@angular/material/input';
    11	
    12	@Component({
    13	  standalone: true,
    14	  selector: 'app-clients',
    15	  imports: [CommonModule, FormsModule, MatCardModule, MatButtonModule, MatFormFieldModule, MatInputModule],
    16	  template: `
    17	  <mat-card class="card">
    18	    <div style="padding:16px; display:flex; gap:12px; flex-wrap:wrap; align-items:end;">
    19	      <h2 style="margin:0; flex:1 1 auto;">Clients</h2>
    20	
    21	      <mat-form-field appearance="outline">
    22	        <mat-label>Nom complet</mat-label>
    23	        <input matInput [(ngModel)]="fullName">
    24	      </mat-form-field>
    25	
    26	      <mat-form-field appearance="outline">
    27	        <mat-label>Email</mat-label>
    28	        <input matInput [(ngModel)]="email">
    29	      </mat-form-field>
    30	
    31	      <button mat-raised-button (click)="add()">Ajouter</button>
    32	      <button mat-button (click)="load()">RafraÃ®chir</button>
    33	    </div>
    34	
    35	    <div style="padding:0 16px 16px 16px;">
    36	      <div *ngIf="items().length===0" style="opacity:.7;">Aucun client (ou API non dispo).</div>
    37	
    38	      <div *ngFor="let c of items()" style="display:flex; justify-content:space-between; padding:12px 0; border-top:1px solid #eee;">
    39	        <div>
    40	          <div style="font-weight:600;">{{ c.fullName }}</div>
    41	          <div style="opacity:.7;">{{ c.email }}</div>
    42	        </div>
    43	        <button mat-stroked-button (click)="remove(c)" [disabled]="!c.id">Supprimer</button>
    44	      </div>
    45	    </div>
    46	  </mat-card>
    47	  `
    48	})
    49	export class ClientsComponent {
    50	  items = signal<Client[]>([]);
    51	  fullName = '';
    52	  email = '';
    53	
    54	  constructor(private api: ClientsApi) { this.load(); }
    55	
    56	  load() {
    57	    this.api.list().subscribe({ next: v => this.items.set(v), error: () => this.items.set([]) });
    58	  }
    59	
    60	  add() {
    61	    if (!this.fullName.trim() || !this.email.trim()) return;
    62	    this.api.create({ fullName: this.fullName.trim(), email: this.email.trim() }).subscribe({
    63	      next: () => { this.fullName=''; this.email=''; this.load(); }
    64	    });
    65	  }
    66	
    67	  remove(c: Client) {
    68	    if (!c.id) return;
    69	    this.api.delete(c.id).subscribe({ next: () => this.load() });
    70	  }
    71	}

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/src/app/ui/dashboard/dashboard.component.ts -----
     1	import { Component, signal } from '@angular/core';
     2	import { CommonModule } from '@angular/common';
     3	import { ProductsApi } from '../../api/products.api';
     4	import { OrdersApi } from '../../api/orders.api';
     5	import { ClientsApi } from '../../api/clients.api';
     6	
     7	import { MatCardModule } from '@angular/material/card';
     8	
     9	@Component({
    10	  standalone: true,
    11	  selector: 'app-dashboard',
    12	  imports: [CommonModule, MatCardModule],
    13	  template: `
    14	    <div style="display:grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(3, minmax(0,1fr)); gap:16px;">
    15	      <mat-card class="card">
    16	        <div style="padding:16px;">
    17	          <div style="opacity:.7;">Produits</div>
    18	          <div style="font-size:32px; font-weight:700;">{{ productsCount() }}</div>
    19	        </div>
    20	      </mat-card>
    21	
    22	      <mat-card class="card">
    23	        <div style="padding:16px;">
    24	          <div style="opacity:.7;">Commandes</div>
    25	          <div style="font-size:32px; font-weight:700;">{{ ordersCount() }}</div>
    26	        </div>
    27	      </mat-card>
    28	
    29	      <mat-card class="card">
    30	        <div style="padding:16px;">
    31	          <div style="opacity:.7;">Clients</div>
    32	          <div style="font-size:32px; font-weight:700;">{{ clientsCount() }}</div>
    33	        </div>
    34	      </mat-card>
    35	    </div>
    36	  `
    37	})
    38	export class DashboardComponent {
    39	  productsCount = signal(0);
    40	  ordersCount = signal(0);
    41	  clientsCount = signal(0);
    42	
    43	  constructor(products: ProductsApi, orders: OrdersApi, clients: ClientsApi) {
    44	    products.list().subscribe({ next: v => this.productsCount.set(v.length), error: () => this.productsCount.set(0) });
    45	    orders.list().subscribe({ next: v => this.ordersCount.set(v.length), error: () => this.ordersCount.set(0) });
    46	    clients.list().subscribe({ next: v => this.clientsCount.set(v.length), error: () => this.clientsCount.set(0) });
    47	  }
    48	}

    73	  styles: [`.active{font-weight:600}`]
    74	})
    75	export class ShellComponent {
    76	  constructor(private auth: AuthService) {}
    77	
    78	  userEmail = computed(() => this.auth.user()?.email ?? '');
    79	  title = computed(() => 'Microservices Dashboard');
    80	
    81	  logout() { this.auth.logout(); location.href = '/login'; }
    82	}

    33

    35	        Astuce: si l'email contient <b>admin</b> â‡’ rÃ´le ADMIN, sinon USER.
    36	      </div>
    37	    </mat-card>
    38	  </div>
    39	  `
    40	})
    41	export class LoginComponent {
    42	  email = 'admin@demo.com';
    43	  password = 'admin';
    44	
    45	  constructor(private auth: AuthService, private router: Router) {}
    46	
    47	  doLogin() {
    48	    if (!this.email.trim()) return;
    49	    this.auth.login({ email: this.email, password: this.password });
    50	    this.router.navigateByUrl('/app/dashboard');
    51	  }
    52	}

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/src/app/ui/orders/orders.component.ts -----
     1	import { Component, signal } from '@angular/core';
     2	import { CommonModule } from '@angular/common';
     3	import { FormsModule } from '@angular/forms';
     4	
     5	import { OrdersApi } from '../../api/orders.api';
     6	import { ClientsApi } from '../../api/clients.api';
     7	import { ProductsApi } from '../../api/products.api';
     8	
     9	import { Order, Client, Product } from '../../api/api.models';
    10	
    11	import { MatCardModule } from '@angular/material/card';
    12	import { MatButtonModule } from '@angular/material/button';
    13	import { MatFormFieldModule } from '@angular/material/form-field';
    14	import { MatInputModule } from '@angular/material/input';
    15	import { MatSelectModule } from '@angular/material/select';
    16	
    17	@Component({
    18	  standalone: true,
    19	  selector: 'app-orders',
    20	  imports: [
    21	    CommonModule, FormsModule,
    22	    MatCardModule, MatButtonModule,
    23	    MatFormFieldModule, MatInputModule, MatSelectModule
    24	  ],
    25	  template: `
    26	  <mat-card class="card">
    27	    <div style="padding:16px; display:flex; gap:12px; flex-wrap:wrap; align-items:end;">
    28	      <h2 style="margin:0; flex:1 1 auto;">Commandes</h2>
    29	
    30	      <!-- âœ… Client dropdown (for UX) -->
    31	      <mat-form-field appearance="outline" style="min-width:220px;">
    32	        <mat-label>Client</mat-label>
    33	        <mat-select [(ngModel)]="selectedClientId">
    34	          <mat-option *ngFor="let c of clients()" [value]="c.id">
    35	            {{ c.fullName }} ({{ c.email }}) - #{{ c.id }}
    36	          </mat-option>
    37	        </mat-select>
    38	      </mat-form-field>
    39	
    40	      <!-- âœ… Product dropdown -->
    41	      <mat-form-field appearance="outline" style="min-width:260px;">
    42	        <mat-label>Produit</mat-label>
    43	        <mat-select [(ngModel)]="selectedProductId">
    44	          <mat-option *ngFor="let p of products()" [value]="p.id">
    45	            {{ p.name }} - {{ p.price }} MAD - Stock: {{ p.stock }} (#{{ p.id }})
    46	          </mat-option>
    47	        </mat-select>
    48	      </mat-form-field>
    49	
    50	      <mat-form-field appearance="outline" style="width:140px;">
    51	        <mat-label>QuantitÃ©</mat-label>
    52	        <input matInput type="number" min="1" [(ngModel)]="quantity">
    53	      </mat-form-field>
    54	
    55	      <button mat-raised-button (click)="add()" [disabled]="!selectedProductId">CrÃ©er</button>
    56	      <button mat-button (click)="reloadAll()">RafraÃ®chir</button>
    57	    </div>
    58	
    59	    <div style="padding:0 16px 16px 16px;">
    60	      <div *ngIf="items().length===0" style="opacity:.7;">Aucune commande (ou API non dispo).</div>
    61	
    62	      <div *ngFor="let o of items()" style="display:flex; justify-content:space-between; padding:12px 0; border-top:1px solid #eee;">
    63	        <div>
    64	          <div style="font-weight:600;">Order #{{ o.id ?? 'â€”' }}</div>
    65	          <div style="opacity:.7;">
    66	            productId={{ o.productId }}, qty={{ o.quantity }}, status={{ o.status ?? 'â€”' }},
    67	            total={{ o.totalPrice ?? 'â€”' }}
    68	          </div>
    69	        </div>
    70	        <button mat-stroked-button color="warn" (click)="remove(o)" [disabled]="!o.id">Delete</button>
    71	      </div>
    72	    </div>
    73	  </mat-card>
    74	  `
    75	})
    76	export class OrdersComponent {
    77	  items = signal<Order[]>([]);
    78	  clients = signal<Client[]>([]);
    79	  products = signal<Product[]>([]);
    80	
    81	  selectedClientId: number | null = null;   // UX only for now
    82	  selectedProductId: number | null = null;
    83	
    84	  quantity = 1;
    85	
    86	  constructor(
    87	    private ordersApi: OrdersApi,
    88	    private clientsApi: ClientsApi,
    89	    private productsApi: ProductsApi
    90	  ) {
    91	    this.reloadAll();
    92	  }
    93	
    94	  reloadAll() {
    95	    this.loadOrders();
    96	    this.loadClients();
    97	    this.loadProducts();
    98	  }
    99	
   100	  loadOrders() {
   101	    this.ordersApi.list().subscribe({ next: v => this.items.set(v), error: () => this.items.set([]) });
   102	  }
   103	
   104	  loadClients() {
   105	    this.clientsApi.list().subscribe({ next: v => {
   106	      this.clients.set(v);
   107	      if (this.selectedClientId == null && v.length) this.selectedClientId = v[0].id ?? null;
   108	    }, error: () => this.clients.set([]) });
   109	  }
   110	
   111	  loadProducts() {
   112	    this.productsApi.list().subscribe({ next: v => {
   113	      this.products.set(v);
   114	      if (this.selectedProductId == null && v.length) this.selectedProductId = v[0].id ?? null;
   115	    }, error: () => this.products.set([]) });
   116	  }
   117	
   118	  add() {
   119	    if (!this.selectedProductId) return;
   120	    const pid = Number(this.selectedProductId);
   121	    const qty = Number(this.quantity || 1);
   122	
   123	    // âœ… backend expects query params
   124	    this.ordersApi.create(pid, qty).subscribe({
   125	      next: () => this.loadOrders(),
   126	      error: (e) => {
   127	        console.error(e);
   128	        alert("Erreur crÃ©ation commande (voir console).");
   129	      }
   130	    });
   131	  }
   132	
   133	  remove(o: Order) {
   134	    if (!o.id) return;
   135	    this.ordersApi.delete(o.id).subscribe({ next: () => this.loadOrders() });
   136	  }
   137	}

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/src/app/ui/payments/payments.component.ts -----
     1	import { Component, signal } from '@angular/core';
     2	import { CommonModule } from '@angular/common';
     3	import { FormsModule } from '@angular/forms';
     4	
     5	import { MatCardModule } from '@angular/material/card';
     6	import { MatButtonModule } from '@angular/material/button';
     7	import { MatFormFieldModule } from '@angular/material/form-field';
     8	import { MatInputModule } from '@angular/material/input';
     9	
    10	import { PaymentsApi } from '../../api/payments.api';
    11	import { Payment } from '../../api/api.models';
    12	
    13	@Component({
    14	  standalone: true,
    15	  selector: 'app-payments',
    16	  imports: [CommonModule, FormsModule, MatCardModule, MatButtonModule, MatFormFieldModule, MatInputModule],
    17	  template: `
    18	  <mat-card class="card">
    19	    <div style="padding:16px; display:flex; gap:12px; flex-wrap:wrap; align-items:end;">
    20	      <h2 style="margin:0; flex:1 1 auto;">Paiements</h2>
    21	
    22	      <mat-form-field appearance="outline" style="width:140px;">
    23	        <mat-label>Order ID</mat-label>
    24	        <input matInput type="number" [(ngModel)]="orderId">
    25	      </mat-form-field>
    26	
    27	      <mat-form-field appearance="outline" style="width:160px;">
    28	        <mat-label>Amount</mat-label>
    29	        <input matInput type="number" [(ngModel)]="amount">
    30	      </mat-form-field>
    31	
    32	      <mat-form-field appearance="outline" style="width:180px;">
    33	        <mat-label>Method</mat-label>
    34	        <input matInput [(ngModel)]="method" placeholder="CARD / CASH">
    35	      </mat-form-field>
    36	
    37	      <button mat-raised-button (click)="pay()">Payer</button>
    38	      <button mat-button (click)="load()">RafraÃ®chir</button>
    39	    </div>
    40	
    41	    <div style="padding:0 16px 16px 16px;">
    42	      <div *ngIf="items().length===0" style="opacity:.7;">Aucun paiement.</div>
    43	
    44	      <div *ngFor="let p of items()" style="display:flex; justify-content:space-between; padding:12px 0; border-top:1px solid #eee;">
    45	        <div>
    46	          <div style="font-weight:600;">Payment #{{ p.id ?? 'â€”' }} ({{ p.status ?? 'â€”' }})</div>
    47	          <div style="opacity:.7;">orderId={{ p.orderId }}, amount={{ p.amount }}, method={{ p.method }}, at={{ p.createdAt ?? 'â€”' }}</div>
    48	        </div>
    49	      </div>
    50	    </div>
    51	  </mat-card>
    52	  `
    53	})
    54	export class PaymentsComponent {
    55	  items = signal<Payment[]>([]);
    56	  orderId = 1;
    57	  amount = 0;
    58	  method = 'CARD';
    59	
    60	  constructor(private api: PaymentsApi) { this.load(); }
    61	
    62	  load() {
    63	    this.api.list().subscribe({ next: v => this.items.set(v), error: () => this.items.set([]) });
    64	  }
    65	
    66	  pay() {
    67	    this.api.create({ orderId: Number(this.orderId), amount: Number(this.amount), method: this.method })
    68	      .subscribe({ next: () => this.load() });
    69	  }
    70	}

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/src/app/ui/products/products.component.ts -----
     1	import { Component, signal } from '@angular/core';
     2	import { CommonModule } from '@angular/common';
     3	import { FormsModule } from '@angular/forms';
     4	import { ProductsApi } from '../../api/products.api';
     5	import { Product } from '../../api/api.models';
     6	
     7	import { MatCardModule } from '@angular/material/card';
     8	import { MatButtonModule } from '@angular/material/button';
     9	import { MatFormFieldModule } from '@angular/material/form-field';
    10	import { MatInputModule } from '@angular/material/input';
    11	
    12	@Component({
    13	  standalone: true,
    14	  selector: 'app-products',
    15	  imports: [CommonModule, FormsModule, MatCardModule, MatButtonModule, MatFormFieldModule, MatInputModule],
    16	  template: `
    17	  <mat-card class="card">
    18	    <div style="padding:16px; display:flex; gap:12px; flex-wrap:wrap; align-items:end;">
    19	      <h2 style="margin:0; flex:1 1 auto;">Produits</h2>
    20	
    21	      <mat-form-field appearance="outline">
    22	        <mat-label>Nom</mat-label>
    23	        <input matInput [(ngModel)]="name">
    24	      </mat-form-field>
    25	
    26	      <mat-form-field appearance="outline">
    27	        <mat-label>Prix</mat-label>
    28	        <input matInput type="number" [(ngModel)]="price">
    29	      </mat-form-field>
    30	
    31	      <button mat-raised-button (click)="add()">Ajouter</button>
    32	      <button mat-button (click)="load()">RafraÃ®chir</button>
    33	    </div>
    34	
    35	    <div style="padding:0 16px 16px 16px;">
    36	      <div *ngIf="items().length===0" style="opacity:.7;">Aucun produit (ou API non dispo).</div>
    37	
    38	      <div *ngFor="let p of items()" style="display:flex; justify-content:space-between; padding:12px 0; border-top:1px solid #eee;">
    39	        <div>
    40	          <div style="font-weight:600;">{{ p.name }}</div>
    41	          <div style="opacity:.7;">{{ p.price }} MAD</div>
    42	        </div>
    43	        <button mat-stroked-button (click)="remove(p)" [disabled]="!p.id">Supprimer</button>
    44	      </div>
    45	    </div>
    46	  </mat-card>
    47	  `
    48	})
    49	export class ProductsComponent {
    50	  items = signal<Product[]>([]);
    51	  name = '';
    52	  price = 10;
    53	
    54	  constructor(private api: ProductsApi) { this.load(); }
    55	
    56	  load() {
    57	    this.api.list().subscribe({ next: v => this.items.set(v), error: () => this.items.set([]) });
    58	  }
    59	
    60	  add() {
    61	    if (!this.name.trim()) return;
    62	    this.api.create({ name: this.name.trim(), price: Number(this.price) }).subscribe({
    63	      next: () => { this.name=''; this.load(); }
    64	    });
    65	  }
    66	
    67	  remove(p: Product) {
    68	    if (!p.id) return;
    69	    this.api.delete(p.id).subscribe({ next: () => this.load() });
    70	  }
    71	}

     6	    bootstrapApplication(App, config, context);
     7	
     8	export default bootstrap;

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/src/main.ts -----
     1	import { bootstrapApplication } from '@angular/platform-browser';
     2	import { AppComponent } from './app/app.component';
     3	import { appConfig } from './app/app.config';
     4	
     5	bootstrapApplication(AppComponent, appConfig)
     6	  .catch(err => console.error(err));

----- FILE: ecommerce-dashboard/src/server.ts -----
     1	import {
     2	  AngularNodeAppEngine,
     3	  createNodeRequestHandler,
     4	  isMainModule,
     5	  writeResponseToNodeResponse,
     6	} from '@angular/ssr/node';
     7	import express from 'express';
     8	import { join } from 'node:path';
     9	
    10	const browserDistFolder = join(import.meta.dirname, '../browser');
    11	
    12	const app = express();
    13	const angularApp = new AngularNodeAppEngine();
    14	
    15	/**
    16	 * Example Express Rest API endpoints can be defined here.
    17	 * Uncomment and define endpoints as necessary.
    18	 *
    19	 * Example:
    20	 * ```ts
    21	 * app.get('/api/{*splat}', (req, res) => {
    22	 *   // Handle API request
    23	 * });
    24	 * ```
    25	 */
    26	
    27	/**
    28	 * Serve static files from /browser
    29	 */
    30	app.use(
    31	  express.static(browserDistFolder, {
    32	    maxAge: '1y',
    33	    index: false,
    34	    redirect: false,
    35	  }),
    36	);
    37	
    38	/**
    39	 * Handle all other requests by rendering the Angular application.
    40	 */
    41	app.use((req, res, next) => {
    42	  angularApp
    43	    .handle(req)
    44	    .then((response) =>
    45	      response ? writeResponseToNodeResponse(response, res) : next(),
    46	    )
    47	    .catch(next);
    48	});
    49	
    50	/**
    51	 * Start the server if this module is the main entry point, or it is ran via PM2.
    52	 * The server listens on the port defined by the `PORT` environment variable, or defaults to 4000.
    53	 */
    54	if (isMainModule(import.meta.url) || process.env['pm_id']) {
    55	  const port = process.env['PORT'] || 4000;
    56	  app.listen(port, (error) => {
    57	    if (error) {
    58	      throw error;
    59	    }
    60	
    61	    console.log(`Node Express server listening on http://localhost:${port}`);
    62	  });
    63	}
    64	
    65	/**
    66	 * Request handler used by the Angular CLI (for dev-server and during build) or Firebase Cloud Functions.
    67	 */
    68	export const reqHandler = createNodeRequestHandler(app);
